title: AI Automation Engineer & Systems Architect (E-commerce)
description:
We are a high-volume e-commerce brand currently at a crossroads with our support tech stack. We utilize Re:amaze, but we are ready to transition into a fully autonomous, AI-driven operation. We are looking for a Technical Specialist to audit our infrastructure and build an end-to-end automated system capable of resolving 60%+ of tickets without human intervention.



--



PHASE 1: Audit & Systems Design (Immediate)

Infrastructure Audit: Evaluate our Shopify backend and current Re:amaze silos to identify data leakage and integration gaps.



Architectural Recommendation: Provide a data-backed recommendation: Is it technically viable to build on Re:amaze, or do we migrate to an AI-native environment like Gorgias, Intercom, or a custom Zendesk build?



Logic Mapping: Architect the "If/Then" decision trees for our top 5 high-volume manual tasks (WISMO, returns, cancellations).



--



PHASE 2: Engineering & Integration

Deep API Integration: Connect Shopify, 17Track/AfterShip, and the CRM via Webhooks/APIs to ensure the AI has real-time data parity.



Knowledge Base Engineering: Work with our Back-End Manager to transform static SOPs and FAQs into structured data for AI consumption (RAG/Vector databases or native LLM training).



Action-Based Automation: Develop logic-based flows using 
, Zapier, or custom scripts to trigger backend actions.



QA & Optimization: Implement a "Human-in-the-loop" testing framework to ensure 90%+ accuracy before full deployment.



--



TECHNICAL QUALIFICATIONS

Developer Background: Proven experience with APIs, Webhooks, and Liquid variables.



Automation Mastery: Expert-level proficiency in 
 (Integromat) or Zapier for complex multi-step workflows.



CRM Architect: Deep technical knowledge of the backend capabilities of Gorgias, Intercom, or Zendesk.



Prompt Engineering: Ability to program AI models for specific brand voices, empathy, and technical accuracy.



Data-Driven: Ability to demonstrate how your builds specifically reduced First Response Time (FRT) and Resolution Time through code/automation.



--



HOW TO APPLY

Please provide technical answers to the following and use "AI-Engineer" as the Subject.



1. Describe an automation you built that reduced human ticket volume by 30%+. Which specific tools and logic triggers did you use?



2. Map out a workflow for a 'Where is my order?' request where tracking has stalled for 7 days. Describe the If/Then logic and the specific data points you would pull from the Shopify/Shipping API.



3. On a scale of 1-10, how comfortable are you with 
/APIs? Describe the most complex custom connection you’ve engineered.



4. Based on a goal of 50%+ automation, what is your estimated timeline from Audit to Live Launch?

title: Sales Operations Lead — Outbound Systems Builder
description:
About Us

We help property management companies and rental property owners eliminate operational overhead using AI and automation. Our clients manage 100+ rental units on AppFolio. We're early-stage, pre-revenue, and need someone to build and own our outbound sales engine. 

This is not a "follow the playbook" role. We're figuring out the offer and market together. You'll be a partner in that process, not just an executor.



What You'll Own

1. Outbound Engine

Responsibility: Build sequences, automations, lead lists, CRM workflows



2. Channel Execution

Responsibility: Cold
, LinkedIn,
, cold calling — you d
 priority



3. Testing & Iteration

Responsibility: Test messaging and offers. Report what's working. Kill what isn't



4. Metrics

Responsibility: Own the funnel: sent ? replied ? booked ? closed. Weekly reporting



5. Hiring (Later)

Responsibility: Once system works, hire/manage junior executors below you



Initial Focus (First 30 Days)

1. Choose ONE primary outbound channel

2. Build the system end-to-end

3. First outreach live within 7 days of start

4. Hit 10+ qualified conversations/week before adding new channels

No "two weeks of research" before anything happens.



What Success Looks Like

Week 1: First outreach sent, first replies coming in

Week 4: Predictable weekly call volume, clear data on what's converting

Month 3: Repeatable system producing 10+ qualified calls/week with documented playbooks



Requirements

Must Have:

- Built or managed a multi-channel outbound system before (not just executed one channel)

- Experience with sales tools: Apollo, Instantly, SmartLead, LinkedIn Sales Nav, or similar

- Proof of results: pipelines built, conversations generated, conversion metrics

- Strong written and spoken English

- Comfortable with ambiguity — offer and messaging will iterate based on market feedback 



Bonus:

- Experience in real estate, property management, or B2B services

- Can hire and manage cold callers / appointment setters

- Copywriting skills

- Experience with Clay, Phantombuster, Make, or automation tools



Compensation

- Base: $12-18/hr depending on experience

- Performance Bonuses:

$10 per qualified call booked (prospect has 100+ units, uses AppFolio, agrees to call)

$500 per closed deal

Top performers earn significantly more than base through results.



What You're NOT Doing

- Pitching pricing or closing deals — I handle sales calls

- Spending weeks "setting up infrastructure" before first outreach

- Waiting for perfect messaging — we test and iterate live



How to Apply

Fill up this form:

title: Property Management Bookkeeper (QuickBooks + Yardi)
description:
Remote | Part-Time to Start (20–30 hrs/week)



We are a U.S.-based property management company looking for a dedicated bookkeeper with hands-on experience in QuickBooks and Yardi to support our growing portfolio.



This role is focused on accounting and bookkeeping, not sales or marketing. You will work closely with ownership and an existing operations team to reduce workload, improve accuracy, and bring structure to our financial processes.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

- Bookkeeping and accounting in QuickBooks

- Working inside Yardi for property-level accounting

- Accounts payable (vendor bills, utilities, insurance, taxes, fees)

- Reconciling bank accounts and property accounts

- Rent posting and basic delinquency tracking

- Supporting month-end close

- Light data entry related to property accounting

- Coordinating with the operations team when information is missing or unclear



This is not an “everything role.”

Your primary responsibility is accounting accuracy and consistency.



Required Experience (Non-Negotiable)

- QuickBooks: real, hands-on bookkeeping experience

- Yardi: direct experience using Yardi for property management

- Prior work with property management or real estate accounting

- Strong attention to detail

- Comfortable working with multiple properties and vendors

If you have Yardi experience but are weaker in QuickBooks, you must be willing and able to learn quickly.



Nice to Have (Not Required)

- Experience with U.S. property management companies

- Familiarity with utilities, insurance, and property taxes

- Experience supporting audits or cleanups

- Ability to document processes clearly



Work Setup & Pay

- Remote (Philippines preferred)

- Part-time to start (20–30 hours/week)

- Hourly pay: $6–$8 USD/hour, based on experience

- Opportunity for increased hours and long-term role if successful



Who This Role Is For

- You are a specialist, not a generalist

- You prefer clear responsibilities and structure

- You take ownership of accuracy

- You communicate when something is missing or unclear instead of guessing



Who This Role Is NOT For

- “Jack-of-all-trades” VAs

- Candidates with only theoretical QuickBooks knowledge

- Candidates who have never worked inside Yardi

- Anyone looking for a sales or customer-facing role



How to Apply

Please complete the form here: 



Applications without specific QuickBooks and Yardi experience will not be considered.

title: OPERATIONS SUPERVISOR
description:
## **Position Overview**



The Operations Supervisor serves as the central control point between Recruitment, Team Success, Client Growth, and active Virtual Assistants (VAs). This role ensures that VAs are deployment-ready, performance-aligned, properly trained, attendance-compliant, and operationally stable.



The Operations Supervisor upholds performance standards, identifies risks early, and resolves operational issues before they impact clients. This is a high-accountability role requiring decisiveness, strong systems thinking, and the ability to enforce structure while maintaining professional communication.



**Core Objectives**

* Ensure only qualified, performance-ready VAs are endorsed and deployed to clients

* Uphold operational discipline across attendance, reporting compliance, and KPI achievement

* Strengthen training frameworks to address recurring skill gaps and performance deficiencies

* Minimize escalations through proactive monitoring and early intervention

* Safeguard alignment with CBA operational standards and internal MT processes

* Optimize workforce allocation and redeployment to maintain stability, efficiency, and client continuity



# **Key Responsibilities**



## 1. Deployment Optimization (Internal EAs)

* Facilitate VA profiling in collaboration with the Team Success Manager upon receipt of new VA requests

* Assess VA eligibility for additional client assignments using established performance standards, including:



  * KPI attainment and quota consistency

  * Accuracy and reliability of End-of-Day (EOD) submissions

  * Attendance track record and dependability

  * Historical client feedback and performance evaluations

* Recommend deployment-ready candidates based on performance data, work ethic, communication quality, and behavioral indicators

* Secure onboarding confirmations and ensure attendance on scheduled deployment dates

* Notify Recruitment of paused VAs eligible for reassignment

* Provide insights to support workforce planning and manpower distribution



## 2. Training & Capability Development



* Lead structured Near Hire Training sessions to ensure deployment readiness

* Review assessments and formally endorse qualified candidates for client placement

* Oversee Refresher Training programs to close skill and performance gaps

* Partner with the Team Success Manager to identify Subject Matter Experts and high-impact training topics

* Deliver training sessions as needed to reinforce operational standards

* Identify recurring workflow gaps requiring targeted upskilling

* Design and develop structured learning modules, guides, and training materials

* Evaluate post-training performance to measure retention and operational improvement

* Maintain a centralized training tracker to monitor participation and measurable outcomes

* Recommend curriculum enhancements based on performance data and operational trends



## 3. Attendance Monitoring & Workforce Stability



* Serve as the primary authority for VA attendance oversight and compliance

* Monitor daily clock-ins, shift adherence, and attendance patterns

* Issue formal, documented warnings for excessive tardiness or unexcused absences in accordance with company policy

* Provide timely updates to Client Growth regarding attendance issues affecting clients

* Escalate chronic violations to the Operations Manager

* Maintain accurate documentation of attendance records and corrective actions



## 4. Client Service Pause Management

* Communicate service pause decisions clearly and professionally to affected VAs

* Collaborate with Team Success to identify redeployment opportunities

* Maintain engagement with paused VAs to preserve morale and readiness

* Track reassignment eligibility and reactivation timelines



## 5. Performance Management & Coaching

* Monitor daily, weekly, and monthly KPIs to ensure consistent performance attainment

* Enforce EOD reporting compliance and ensure submission accuracy

* Detect early indicators of underperformance through trend analysis

* Conduct structured coaching sessions and implement corrective action plans

* Clarify scope-of-work expectations to protect client satisfaction

* Escalate repeated performance concerns with proper documentation

* Maintain detailed performance records for audits and reviews

* Update FAQs, SOPs, and operational guidelines based on recurring challenges



## 6. System & Process Oversight

* Maintain comprehensive knowledge of company workflows and operational systems

* Enforce adherence to established processes and standards

* Identify inefficiencies, workflow gaps, and bottlenecks

* Recommend and document structured process improvements

* Safeguard data integrity across reporting and tracking systems



## 7. People Management & Escalation Handling

* Respond promptly to VA inquiries and escalations using structured problem-solving

* Reinforce accountability while maintaining professionalism

* Ensure proper documentation of concerns, actions, and resolutions

* Serve as the first line of operational resolution before escalation to senior leadership

* Foster a culture of discipline, clarity, and performance excellence



 **Qualifications**

* **2–3 years of experience in Logistics and Executive Assistance**, with direct exposure to supporting leadership or senior management

* Proven experience in operations, workforce management, or team supervision

* Strong performance management and coaching capabilities

* Demonstrated ability to coordinate logistics, manage schedules, and support high-level stakeholders

* High attention to detail with strong analytical and data-driven decision-making skills

* Ability to enforce standards while maintaining professional relationships

* Strong documentation, reporting, and process management skills

* Excellent communication, escalation handling, and conflict resolution abilities

* Experience in training facilitation and curriculum development is preferred



If you think you’re the one we’re looking for, kindly send us your updated CV along with a 1-2min self intro. Thank you!

? Work closely with content creators, creative strategists, and media buyers to deliver assets that perform

? Collaborate on new ad concepts and contribute creative input during brainstorming

? Stay ahead of platform trends, 
 culture, and editing styles to keep our content fresh

? Manage and organize video assets, templates, and versioning for efficient turnaround

? Continuously iterate based on data and feedback to improve performance



???? What We’re Looking For

?? Performance-Driven Editing – You know what keeps people watching and what drives clicks and sales

?? DTC E-commerce Experience – You’ve edited successful ads for other ecommerce DTC brands (fitness/fashion = big plus)

?? Fast Turnaround – You can edit fast without sacrificing quality

?? Strong Visual Taste – Your edits look polished, modern, and high-converting

?? Collaborative Yet Independent – You’re great at taking feedback, and even better at working on your own

?? Organized & Detail-Oriented – You don’t miss deadlines and your file management is on point

???? Mandatory Requirement

Candidates must be able to deliver 5–10 creative briefs per week, covering formats from 30-second videos to 2–3+ minute VSLs



???? Why Join Skinnify?

???? Work on Your Terms – Full flexibility. Work whenever and wherever you want, as long as you deliver results

???? Join a Hyper-Growth Brand – From 0 to 120,000+ customers in 2 years.

???? Make a Real Impact – Your edits will directly influence sales and brand growth

???? Take Ownership – You’ll have creative freedom to shape our visual style

???? Learn & Grow Fast – Collaborate with high-performing creatives, strategists, and media buyers



???????? The Skinnify Story

Skinnify started when our founder Christian realized most women wanted to get in shape but lacked the time or motivation for regular workouts. After training with resistance bands, he had an idea: what if resistance bands were built into leggings?

The result? Resistance Band Leggings – leggings that make every step a workout. Since then, we’ve launched sleeves, shoes, and more. Our mission is simple: make fitness effortless by turning movement into exercise.



???? Skinnify’s Core Values

???? Innovation – We design new, groundbreaking clothing with built-in resistance to revolutionize fitness.

???? Effectiveness – Our products help people burn more calories & get fitter with every step.

???? Accessibility – We make fitness accessible to everyone - even the busiest and least motivated.

???? Fun – We make exercise feel effortless and enjoyable.

? Quality – Our products are built to last - high-quality, durable, and reliable.



Ready to edit your way into the future of fitness? Apply now and let’s create something powerful.

title: Cinematic Video Editor — AI-Native Storytelling
description:
JOB TITLE: Cinematic Video Editor — AI-Native Luxury Storytelling

SALARY: 1100 USD/Month

TYPE: Full-time (40 hours/week)

LOCATION: Remote (Philippines)

SCHEDULE: Async, with Vancouver overlap (PST) for feedback



THE MISSION

Prismiera is a luxury jewelry brand launching a short-form video series — stories about mythology, history, spies, poisoners, queens, alchemists, and beauty told through museum-grade aesthetics. Our shorts should feel cinematic, elegant, hypnotic, visceral, and expensive. (Be prepared to innovate as demands and trends change.)

You will receive scripts, AI tool access, and style references. Your job is to build the scene: generate AI visuals, source archival footage, layer sound design, add voiceover from elevenlabs, and deliver shorts where every second earns the next.

We are hiring for taste, cinematic instinct, and the ability to treat AI generation as a serious production tool.



THE STYLE

Multiple styles as demand and trends change; Dark luxury. Museum. Stylish and lethal. Rich textures. Controlled palette. Both silence and impact used with intention. Every cut has a reason.

Not: default presets, stock photo slideshows.



WHAT YOU'LL DO

Produce vertical shorts (YouTube Shorts / TikTok / Reels) end-to-end using our scripts, style kits, and current channel benchmarks:



Edit: Assemble 30-120s vertical shorts with elegant pacing and restraint. The voiceover leads — visuals serve. You know when to let a line breathe and when to accelerate.

Generate: Create supporting visuals using AI image and video tools (Seedream, Veo, Kling, and whatever launches next). We provide all paid accounts and internal prompting workflows — you bring creative judgment and iteration speed.

Music & Sound: Beat-matching, swells, drops, and silence to drive visual storytelling. You understand rhythm as an editing tool — not decoration.

Product Integration: Place static jewelry photos into moving scenes so they look physically present — masking, light/shadow matching, subtle color grading. Convincing realism, not floating stickers. (AI can handle lot of this, but requires a good eye for it.)

Finish: Minimal kinetic typography + copyright-safe or licensed classical/atmospheric audio (Generated via Suno).

File Hygiene: Clean bin structure, naming conventions. Project files and assets uploaded to Notion/
.





CORE REQUIREMENTS



The Eye (Taste and Edit execution is priority. AI tools are quick to learn). You instinctively know the difference between luxury and cheap. Starting out, you'll receive reference videos of our current benchmarks and experimental formats. Your job is to match that standard consistently and innovate on top of them.

Voiceover-First Storytelling. You edit to narration first, music second. You never bury a punchline under a flashy transition.

Retention Instinct. The first frame is an ad for the second frame. You know what stops a scroll. You build hooks visually. Every 2–3 seconds, something changes.

AI Fluency. You're comfortable generating, iterating, and curating AI output across image and video tools. You treat generation as production — prompting, reviewing, selecting, and refining until the output meets the standard.

Adobe Premiere Pro. Required for project handoffs and consistency.

Strong English. Daily async communication — clear, direct, and professional.

Reliable & Coachable. You hit deadlines or warn early. You take direct feedback and iterate fast. You flag problems with options, not excuses.



Bonus (not required, but noticed):

After Effects compositing, Mocha tracking, advanced color grading, sound design beyond music (SFX layering, risers, hits).



VOLUME & DELIVERABLES



Ramp-up (first 2–3 weeks): 2–3 shorts/week as you learn the brand voice and pipeline

Steady state: Push to 4 high quality vertical shorts per week.

Deliverables: 1080×1920 minimum, 30fps, MP4 (H.264)





SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS



RAM: 16GB minimum (32GB preferred) + SSD

Reliable high-speed internet (upload speed matters)

Must run Premiere Pro and browser-based AI tools simultaneously without issue





PAID TRIAL (Shortlisted Candidates)

Before any full-time commitment, we run a paid weekly trial. We provide scripts, elevenlabs access for voiceover, and style references/benchmarks. You deliver 30–50 second shorts. Trial is compensated at $250 USD at the end of each week. If it's a mutual fit after 30 days, we transition to bi-weekly payments of $550 (before work).

This protects both sides — you see whether the work fits your strengths, we see whether the output fits our brand.



WHAT WE OFFER



Paid accounts for all frontier AI tools

Creative identity — you're building the visual language of a brand from launch, not filling someone else's template

Clear briefs — scripts, audio files, mood boards, and reference videos for every batch

Direct feedback — specific, constructive notes on every edit

A brand worth building — Prismiera launches soon, with a second and third AI-native brands after that, which cover a wide variety of content scopes. You're helping build the machine.





OWNERSHIP & CONFIDENTIALITY

All outputs (edits, project files, prompts, generated assets) are Prismiera property and must remain confidential.



HOW TO APPLY

Important: Use at least 7 Apply Points when applying on OnlineJobs.ph.

Subject line: PRISMIERA EDITOR — [Your Favorite Historical Art Era]

Send only the following (numbered exactly):



Portfolio. Links to your 3 best vertical shorts (mood/atmosphere preferred — not vlogs). Label one that demonstrates music-driven pacing.

The Story Test. Link to ONE short that includes voiceover or spoken dialogue. We need to see that you can pace visuals to a script. (Can overlap with #1.)

Luxury Test (3–5 bullets). How do you make an edit feel "expensive" instead of "cheap"?

AI Experience (1–2 sentences). What is your experience level with generative AI tools? If none, say so — we'll evaluate the rest on its own merits.

Technical (exactly 3 sentences). Describe your approach to compositing a static product photo into a moving scene so it looks physically present.

Specs. PC specs (CPU / GPU / RAM / SSD) + internet upload speed (screenshot preferred).

Integrity (1–2 sentences). Describe a time you missed a deadline or made a mistake — what did you do next?

The Rewrite. Rewrite this sentence in a cinematic tone: "She is really cool and strong and she wins."

title: Senior Bookkeeper *Superstar Only*
description:
We are looking for two experienced bookkeepers to join our finance team and take ownership of expense categorization, transaction reconciliation, accounts payable, and invoice processing across multiple legal entities.



The bookkeepers will work closely with the CFO, ensuring that all financial transactions are accurately recorded, categorized, and reconciled on a regular basis. This role is ideal for someone who is detail-oriented, organized, and comfortable managing financial data across multiple platforms — including Xero, Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and our custom CRM.



Key Responsibilities

- Categorize all expenses and transactions in Xero, ensuring accurate classification for reporting and compliance

- Reconcile transactions across multiple payment platforms, including Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and custom CRM tools

- Manage accounts payable, ensuring all invoices are properly reviewed, recorded, and scheduled for payment

- Assist with invoice processing, ensuring all vendor invoices are accurately documented and match purchase orders where applicable

- Work closely with the CFO to provide up-to-date financial records for monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting

- Ensure all financial data is accurate and properly organized to support compliance across multiple jurisdictions

- Flag discrepancies or unusual transactions for review by the CFO



What We’re Looking For

- At least 5 years of experience in bookkeeping and expense reconciliation

- Strong proficiency in Xero

- Experience working with Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and custom CRMs

- Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

- Experience handling multi-entity, multi-currency financial data preferred

- Comfortable working in a remote-first environment

- Fluent in English, both written and spoken



Requirements for Effective Remote Work

- Reliable computer or laptop capable of photo and video editing

- Stable high-speed internet connection

- Conducive work environment



Working Schedule

- Full-time opportunity

- Remote work setup (Philippines-based applicants only)



Benefits

- Competitive pay

- Training and growth opportunities

- Opportunity to work with a fast-growing content-driven company



Salary range

- Php 40,000 - Php 65,000 (based on experience)



Application Instructions

Since this is a long-term position, there will be an in-depth qualification process. If you believe you have what it takes, here is what to do next:



Please go to the link below, review the questions carefully, and share the required information.






If you believe you meet our qualifications and requirements, we encourage you to apply now and become a valuable part of our rapidly expanding company.

title: Para-Broker / Mortgage Broking Credit Analyst
description:
Para Broker - Credit Analyst – Australian Mortgage Broking (Medical & Complex Lending Specialist)

Work from Home | Full-Time | 60,000 - 75,000 PHP pm



Are you an EXPERIENCED / SENIOR Para-broker or Credit Analyst ready to level up your career and be part of a thriving, high-performing team? We're an established mortgage brokerage based in Australia, specialising in Finance for Medical professionals — but we handle residential (owner-occupied and investment), commercial, SMSF, complex, and high-net-worth lending.



We're not your average brokerage. Every day is different. Every file presents a new challenge. Our clients are driven, intelligent professionals — and they expect the same from us.



That’s why we’re looking for a **GENUINLY EXPERIENCED** Credit Analyst / Para - Broker — not someone who ONLY submits applications via AOL or plays a broker support/admin role.



What We’re Looking For:



End-to-end experience: From researching borrowing structures, assessing servicing, recommending lenders, and preparing strong applications — through to following deals to settlement.



Confident across multiple loan types: You’ve worked on residential, investment, commercial, SMSF, and trusts, and you're comfortable navigating credit policy across major banks and non-bank lenders.



EXCELLENT English communication skills: You’ll liaise directly with brokers and sometimes clients — explaining your recommendations clearly and concisely.



Problem-solving mindset: You enjoy working through complex deals and helping find smart, viable solutions.



Not a support role: If your background is primarily in administration or document collection/submission only, this role is NOT suitable.



A successful applicant will have experience working with AOL, Mercury & Quickly. If you do not know what these programs are, then you are NOT qualified to enquire for this role. 



Why Join Us?



* Work with a tight-knit team of 3 brokers and 3 support staff who LOVE what they do

* We have a 100% approval track record and highly satisfied clients — your work will directly impact real outcomes

* Above-market salary for the right candidate — we pay well and value skill

* A fun, fast-paced culture — every day is different, and we keep things exciting

* Full-time, permanent, work-from-home role: Monday to Friday, 9am to 6pm AEST





How to Apply



Please DO NOT send a CV only.



We want to hear from you.

Send us a short VIDEO INTRODUCTION  (2–4 minutes) where you:



* Walk us through your experience as a Credit Analyst

* Explain the types of loans and clients you’ve worked with

* Tell us how your role differs from broker support or admin staff

* Show us your communication style and English fluency



Upload your video to Google Drive or YouTube (unlisted) and include the link in your application. Failure to do this will result in AUTOMATIC DECLINE of your application, as it will show a lack of attention to detail. ATTENTION TO DETAIL is KEY to this role.  



If you're a true credit analyst who loves problem-solving, has a high attention to detail, excellent English, thrives in a high-achieving team, and wants to work on complex deals that challenge you — this is your next great opportunity.



We look forward to seeing your video!

title: Account Manager
description:
**About The Laundry Brothers**



We’re a fast-growing laundry & dry cleaning pickup and delivery company serving busy families and businesses in Vancouver, Canada. Our promise is simple: we remove “laundry” from our customers’ lives with reliable pickup, professional cleaning, and on-time delivery, every week.



We’re looking for a **Remote Account Manager** who will treat our customers like their own and help us keep every client feeling informed, cared for, and taken seriously.



This is a **long-term role** with real growth for the right person.



---



### Role Overview



Your main job:  

Keep our customers happy, informed, and staying with us for a long time.



You will:



- Be the main point of contact for a group of residential and/or commercial customers  

- Respond to questions via
, SMS, and calls (no cold calling)  

- Proactively check in with key accounts and solve small issues before they become big problems  

- Coordinate with our internal team (drivers, laundry facility, CSRs) to make sure promises are kept  

- **Occasionally respond to urgent client issues outside of strict 9–5 hours when something time-sensitive comes up (missed pickup, delivery issue, etc.)**  

- Track issues, requests, and follow-ups in our systems (CleanCloud, Google Sheets, Slack, etc.)



This is **not** a “read a script and disappear” job. We want someone who takes ownership, communicates clearly, and thinks ahead for the customer.



---



### Responsibilities



- Manage day-to-day communication with assigned customers  

- Follow up on missed pickups, special requests, and service issues  

- Log notes and updates in our systems so the team always knows what’s happening  

- Monitor customer satisfaction and flag at-risk accounts early  

- Help onboard new subscription or commercial customers so they have a smooth first month  

- Suggest simple process improvements when you see recurring problems  

- **Be reachable and willing to handle occasional urgent issues when time-sensitive problems arise**



---



### Requirements



- 2+ years experience in **Account Management, Client Success, or Customer Support** (B2C or B2B)  

- Excellent written and spoken English

title: Executive Assistant (CEO Support)
description:
Executive Assistant (CEO Support)



We’re hiring an Executive Assistant to the CEO (high-performance role). This is not a traditional personal assistant role. This is not diary-policing or life admin.



This is a business execution support role for a CEO running a fast-paced architecture practice.



You are here to protect focus, increase leverage, and ensure the CEO’s time is spent on the highest-value work.



DARCH (Doroch Architects) is a Sydney-based Architecture Practice, founded by Pavlo Doroch. We design high-end apartment building projects and design to improve life. Our team is based all over Australia and in the Philippines.



We operate in a high-performance, execution-led environment. We value clarity, standards, follow-through, and pace.

This role exists to act as an execution partner to the CEO: keeping priorities clear, decisions moving, and initiatives progressing.



You are not here to manage personal life logistics. You are here to support the business engine at a high standard.



Your Job

As Executive Assistant to the CEO, you will:

? Manage the CEO’s business calendar, priorities, and meeting flow

? Prepare agendas, briefs, and decision context ahead of key meetings

? Ensure meetings start prepared and end with clear actions

? Track follow-ups, decisions, and commitments across teams

? Coordinate across leadership, advisors, and external partners

? Triage inboxes and communication with sound judgment

? Handle sensitive information with discretion

? Support planning cycles, reporting, and key initiatives

? Identify friction, gaps, and risks early and resolve or escalate appropriately



This is not a passive admin role. You are expected to think ahead, connect dots, and close loops.



This Role Is for You If You:

? Have supported a CEO, founder, or senior leader before

? Experience in Project Management

? Think in priorities, not tasks

? Are structured, calm, and reliable under pressure

? Communicate clearly and professionally

? Are proactive and take ownership

? Understand confidentiality and trust

? Enjoy being close to decision-making without needing the spotlight

? Are highly organised and able to take complexity, consolidate it, and turn it into clear, actionable next steps



This Role Is Not for You If You:

? Are looking for a purely task-based admin role

? Need constant instruction

? Prefer slow-moving or low-accountability environments



What You’ll Own

1. Executive Leverage

? Calendar and priority management

? Meeting preparation and follow-through

? Decision and action tracking

2. Coordination & Communication

? Inbox and message triage

? Cross-team coordination

? External partner communication

3. Planning & Ops Support

? Support quarterly and annual planning

? Assist with live events, travel, and logistics

? Maintain organisation across key initiatives



Upside

? Full-time, salaried role

? Close exposure to senior leadership and how decisions are made

? Accelerated development inside a scaling business

? Increased responsibility as trust is earned





Location

Remote role — Philippines, Manila-based (working Sydney time zone)



Application Requirements

• Submit a 3–5 minute Loom video introducing yourself, outlining:

o Your previous experience supporting a CEO, founder, or senior leader

o Why this role suits you

o What high performance means to you

• Attach your CV with relevant experience clearly outlined

title: Full Time Recruiter | Remote
description:
We’re The Laundry Brothers — a fast-growing Canadian laundry & dry-cleaning company — and we’re hiring a Part-Time Recruiter (4 hours/day, Monday–Friday) to help us source, screen, and select high-quality candidates as we scale.



You must have experience recruiting for North American companies, excellent written/spoken English, and confidence hosting online group interviews. You should also be tech-savvy and comfortable using tools like Calendly, HubSpot, Asana, Zoom, and Google Workspace. Experience using AI tools (ChatGPT, etc.) to write job posts or improve workflows is a plus.





Key Responsibilities

• Source qualified applicants for multiple roles

• Host online group interviews and confidently lead conversations

• Conduct preliminary 1:1 video interviews when needed

• Score candidates based on our criteria and recommend top applicants

• Coordinate and schedule in-person interviews with our leadership team

• Manage the applicant pipeline inside HubSpot CRM

• Handle scheduling and confirmations through Calendly

• Maintain organized tasks and updates in Asana

• Communicate professionally with candidates via
 and chat

• Help write or improve job posts using AI tools

• Ensure a fast, smooth, and well-organized hiring process





Requirements

• Experience recruiting for US/Canada companies

• Strong English communication (written + spoken)

• Confident running group interviews on Zoom or Google Meet

• Familiar with HubSpot, Calendly, Asana, Google Suite

• Organized, reliable, and able to evaluate candidate fit quickly

• Comfortable on video and speaking to groups

IMPORTANT — HOW TO APPLY



To be considered, you must apply using the form below:



Apply Here:

title: Video Editor / Graphic Designer
description:

title: TikTok Manager
description:
Hi there! I am a new tiktok creator and looking for a full-time person to manage my tiktok and grow with me over the coming years. I am a happy and positive person, so I am looking for someone like that. Preferably a stay-at-home person that is looking for a full-time position to grow together:)



Please let me know why you are the perfect person for this job, and the level 1-10 of the below.



It is important for me to find someone that is highly dedicated and is looking for a full-time + long term commitment. 



I am looking to bring on someone that will stay with us at least for 3-5 + years. Also, I am looking for someone that can write a lot of comments, so your English level should be relatively high to compete for this position.



Questions:

1. Have you ever managed social media? How many years?

2. How well do you understand TikTok? 1-10?

3. Are you available on a full-time basis?

4. Are you fluent in english? If not, skill level 1-10?

5. What is the level of your english writing? 1-10?

6. Can you agree to my salary (See note below) Yes or No.

7. Can you commit to at least 2026 with me so we can grow together?



ONLY serious applicants need to apply. This is NOT a freelance position, this is a full-time position that is looking to build continue building a team in the Philippines - with YOU!



Salary Note: This social media manager position starts at PHP 7,000/month on Feb 15th. It will go up in Year 2 once we have some success, so I am looking for a long-term partner that is willing to grow and build WITH ME - TOGETHER, and with a positive, happy, cheerful attitude:)



Thank you!

title: Video-First Designer
description:
Salary: $2,000 per month (paid bi-weekly)

Hours: UK hours, 9am–5pm (Mon–Fri)

Contract: Long-term, full-time



About Us

We work with 7–8 figure eCommerce brands, helping them scale through high-performing paid advertising across Meta 
 & Instagram) and Google. We’re an agency, so the environment is fast-paced, performance-driven, and focused on creative that converts.



The Role

We’re looking for a Video-First Designer to join our creative team. This role is primarily focused on short-form and long-form video content for paid ads and social platforms.



Video is currently our biggest growth area — so strength in video is essential. Static design skills are a bonus, but video comes first.



You’ll be working from raw assets (UGC, product footage, images, brand assets) and will be expected to handle multiple projects and brands at the same time, as is standard in an agency environment.



What You’ll Be Creating

Instagram Reels

TikToks

YouTube videos (short & long-form)

Paid social video ads

Occasional static ads (bonus, not the core focus)





Key Responsibilities

Edit and produce high-performing video content from raw assets

Manage and deliver work across multiple clients and projects simultaneously

Adapt content for different platforms and formats

Apply creative trends while keeping performance in mind

Collaborate closely with paid media and creative teams

Work efficiently to meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced agency setting





Requirements

Strong video editing experience (this is non-negotiable)

Proven experience creating Reels, TikToks, and YouTube videos

Experience working on multiple projects at once in a fast-paced environment (agency experience is a strong advantage)

Proficiency in tools such as Premiere Pro, After Effects, Final Cut Pro, CapCut, or similar

Understanding of social media trends and performance-driven creative

Ability to work UK hours reliably

Strong communication and attention to detail





Nice to Have (Not Essential)

Experience designing static ads (Photoshop / Illustrator)

eCommerce or paid advertising experience

Prior agency experience





Why Join Us

Long-term, stable remote role

Competitive monthly pay, paid bi-weekly

Clear video-first role (not a generalist designer position)

Fast-moving agency environment with strong learning opportunities





To apply:

Please submit your CV and portfolio, along with video examples (e.g., Reels, TikToks, YouTube edits).

title: Social Media Manager/ Marketer
description:
Social Media Manager & Performance Marketer 



About the role

We’re hiring a hands-on Social Media Manager & Marketer who can help us push the lever—not just post content, but drive engagement, leads, and conversions. You’ll own our
-first organic + paid engine, translate our offers into content people act on, and use data to improve results week to week.



This role is ideal for someone who’s both creative + strategic: you can plan campaigns, write strong hooks, understand audiences, and make decisions using FB analytics.





Key responsibilities



Strategy & planning

 • Build and maintain a simple, repeatable content strategy aligned to our offers.

 • Turn themes/offers into weekly content plans (posts, short videos, carousels, stories).

 • Plan monthly campaign rhythms (event pushes, reminders, recaps, lead magnets).



Content creation & execution

 • Create content assets (Canva + simple video edits) and write captions.

 • Write strong hooks + CTAs, short-form scripts, and story-based posts.

 • Schedule content consistently and keep everything on-brand.



 growth + community

 • Support community engagement (comments, DM prompts, discussion posts, polls).

 • Identify what content sparks conversations and double down on it.



Analytics & optimization

 • Track FB performance weekly (reach, engagement, CTR, saves/shares, leads).

 • Use insights to iterate what we post and how we improve conversions.

 • Produce a simple weekly snapshot + monthly summary.



Lead conversion

 • Improve conversion from social ? inquiry/booking:

 • stronger CTAs and link flow

 • DM-to-book scripts (if applicable)

 • basic funnel thinking

 • Work with our systems to tag leads and route them to the right next step.



Paid ads (bonus, not required but valuable)

 • Assist with Meta ads setup/optimization (creative testing, audiences, retargeting, lead forms).

 • Help turn winning organic content into paid creatives.







Requirements

Must-haves

 • Strong understanding of
 content + analytics (Meta Business Suite insights).

 • Strategic thinker who can explain why something worked and what to do next.

 • Proven ability to create content that drives actions (leads, bookings, inquiries).

 • Strong copywriting (clear, persuasive, not fluffy).

 • Reliable execution and consistency.



Nice-to-haves

 • Experience running Meta ads.

 • Funnel knowledge (lead magnets,
 sequences, booking flows).

 • Comfortable working with ClickUp/SOPs and content systems.



Tools

/Meta Business Suite, Canva, scheduling tools (Later/Metricool/Buffer), ClickUp, Google Drive.



Success metrics

 • Consistent weekly output and improved content clarity.

 • Growth in quality engagement (shares/comments/DMs) and link clicks.

 • Improved lead-to-booking conversion.

 • Clear weekly reporting + continuous optimization.



How to apply

Please send:

 1. Portfolio/examples (FB posts/reels/campaigns/ads)

 2. Availability + rate

        3.    Resume

title: Amazon FBA Product Research Datadive Specialist
description:
Job Type:



Project-Based / Part-Time (Recurring Research Projects)



Pay:



$7 USD per completed DataDive



Overview



We are looking for an experienced Amazon FBA product research specialist who is already very familiar with DataDive (Brandon Young method) and Jungle Scout and can begin work right away.



This is not an entry-level VA role.



You must already know how to use these tools professionally.



Tools You MUST Already Know



DataDive (Brandon Young methodology, most important)



Jungle Scout (Catalyst & Product Database)



Google Sheets



If you need training on these tools, please do not apply.



Project Structure



Each project consists of 100 DataDives



After full completion of 100 DataDives, there may be no work for several months, then another project begins.



We expect to complete 400–500 DataDives over the next year.



Your Responsibilities

1. Product Discovery



Use Jungle Scout Catalyst 



Work within niches we specify



Apply correct price and revenue filters we specify



Identify strong product ideas for DataDive



2. DataDive Execution



Select at least 10 (15 is better) very similar competing products. If there are not 10 very similar competing products to select then a datadive can't be done for this niche.



Identify when niches should be split into multiple valid dives



(example: battery vs rechargeable versions)



Run separate DataDives when appropriate



3. Keyword Cleanup



Clean the Master Keyword List



Remove brand names



Remove irrelevant phrases



4. Keyword Expansion



Review Outliers and Residue keywords



Add relevant phrases when appropriate



5. Product Scorecard



Complete as much of the product scorecard in DataDive as possible



6. Google Sheet Reporting



For each DataDive, provide:



Link to the completed DataDive



Average variations per seller (found in Master Keyword List section)



Average price (found in Master Keyword List section)



Average listing age (found in Master Keyword List section)



Search volume percentage (found in Overview section)



Average rating (found in Master Keyword List section)



Important Notes



We care about correct execution, not on finding “good” products



Some DataDives will be strong, many will not — this is expected



You must be able to work independently and follow the workflow accurately



How to Apply



Please include:



Your experience using DataDive 



How long you have been doing Amazon product research



Confirmation that you are familiar with Brandon Young’s DataDive method



Any examples of past research work (optional)



Applications without real DataDive experience will not be considered.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
We are seeking a highly organized, proactive Executive Assistant to provide high-level administrative and operational support across multiple growing businesses. This is a fast-paced role that requires exceptional time management, discretion, adaptability, and the ability to manage competing priorities with professionalism.



You will be a key partner to the executive, helping create structure, follow-through, and operational efficiency across multiple entities. This is not a task-only position. We are looking for someone who thinks ahead, anticipates needs, and takes ownership.



Key Responsibilities:

-Administrative & Executive Support

-Manage calendars, scheduling, and appointments across multiple businesses

-Coordinate meetings, prepare agendas, take minutes, and track action items

-Handle correspondence,
s, and communications on behalf of the executive

-Act as a gatekeeper and liaison between executives, partners, and stakeholders

-Operations & Business Management

-Assist with day-to-day operations across multiple business entities

-Track deadlines, deliverables, and ongoing projects

-Organize and maintain digital files and documentation systems

-Improve workflows and implement systems to increase efficiency

-Financial & Documentation Support

-Assist with invoicing, expense tracking, and bookkeeping coordination

-Prepare reports, presentations, and executive summaries

-Manage contracts, agreements, and compliance documentation

-Project & Coordination Support

-Coordinate vendors, contractors, and service providers

-Support special projects from planning through execution

-Follow up consistently to ensure timely completion of tasks

-Confidentiality & Professionalism

-Handle sensitive information with discretion and integrity

-Maintain a high level of professionalism in all communications



Required Skills & Qualifications:

-Proven experience as an Executive Assistant (minimum 3+ years preferred)

-Experience supporting multiple executives or businesses is a strong advantage

-Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

-Strong organizational and multitasking abilities



Proficiency with:

-Google Workspace

-Calendar management tools

-Project management systems (Asana, ClickUp, Monday, etc.)

-Ability to work independently and anticipate needs

-High attention to detail and strong problem-solving skills



Work Requirements:

-Full-time position

-Must be available during U.S. business hours (Central Time preferred overlap)

-Reliable high-speed internet

title: Digital Marketing Virtual Assistant
description:
Hiring a part-time Virtual Assistant to support a fast-moving fractional CMO and systems operator who works with medical practices, professional service firms, and podcast-driven businesses. This role is designed to grow into a full-time position for the right person.

You will be the operational backbone — keeping projects moving, keeping communication clean, and making sure nothing falls through the cracks. This is not a basic data-entry VA role. We need someone who is organized, proactive, communicates clearly, and can work independently once trained.

Working Hours

This role requires availability during Pacific Standard Time (PST) business hours. You must have prior experience working PST or US West Coast hours. Please do not apply if you cannot commit to these hours.

What You Will Do

Your time will be split roughly across three areas:

 

Project Management (~40%)

• Receive task briefs via
 and assign them to the appropriate freelancer

• Track deadlines and follow up with freelancers to ensure on-time delivery

• Check Google Drive and Dropbox for client content, move files to editors, collect finished work, and route to posting

• Flag delays and keep projects moving without needing to be chased

 

Content & Social Media (~40%)

• Schedule and post content across social media platforms using a scheduling tool (Buffer, Later, or similar)

• Generate captions and copy using AI tools and pre-built prompts

• Create short video clips from long-form podcast or video content using CapCut or Premiere Pro templates

• Upload content to YouTube and podcast channels with AI-generated titles and descriptions

 

Administrative Support (~20%)

• Manage calendar invites — sending, receiving, and keeping the calendar accurate

• Receive post-call summary notes via
 and enter them into Notion as organized tasks

• Draft clear task instructions for freelancers and either get sign-off or send directly to the appropriate channel

• Keep communication organized — important tasks go through
, not chat

Tools You Must Already Know

Do not apply if you do not have working knowledge of the following. We will ask you to demonstrate competency during the hiring process. We are looking for a jack-of-all-trades digital marketer — someone who has touched most of these tools and can ramp up quickly on the rest.

 

Project Management & Admin

• Notion — task management, project tracking, and database management (minimum 6/10)

• GoHighLevel (GHL) — CRM navigation, pipeline management, and basic automation (minimum 5/10)

• Google Drive and Dropbox — file management, folder organization, and sharing

•
 — primary channel for all task assignments and project handoffs

• Zoom and Loom — for team check-ins and async training videos

 

Content Creation & Design

• Canva — creating social media graphics, carousels, and branded templates (minimum 6/10)

• AI writing tools — ChatGPT, Claude, or similar for copy generation and prompt building (minimum 7/10)

• Social media scheduling tools — Buffer, Later, or equivalent

 

Video & Audio

• CapCut and/or Premiere Pro — video editing using templates, creating short clips from long-form content (minimum 6/10)

• Podcast audio editing — basic cleanup, trimming, and export for distribution platforms

• YouTube — uploading, titling, tagging, and basic channel management

How We Communicate

•
: All task assignments, project updates, and important deliverables go through

• WhatsApp: Quick questions and fast back-and-forth only — not for tasks

• Zoom: Weekly or bi-weekly syncs

• Loom: Async training videos and how-to walkthroughs

What We Are Looking For

• PST availability — this is non-negotiable

• Digital marketing generalist — you have touched content creation, social media, video editing, CRM tools, and project management. You do not need to be an expert in everything, but you need to be competent across the board.

• Strong written English — you will be communicating with clients and freelancers

• High attention to detail — tasks need to be completed correctly, not just completed

• Self-starter — you can take a rough voice note or
 and turn it into action without step-by-step hand-holding

• Reliability — you show up, you follow through, and you communicate if something goes wrong

• Experience working with US-based founders, marketing agencies, or professional service businesses is a strong plus

What This Is Not

• This is not a role for someone looking for simple copy-paste work

• This is not a role for someone who needs constant supervision

• This is not a good fit if you cannot work PST hours consistently

How to Apply

Send your applicat

title: Customer Support Manager
description:
Customer Support Team Manager (Ecommerce | Dropshipping | Remote)



We are hiring a Customer Support Team Manager to lead and scale support operations across multiple high-volume ecommerce brands.



This is not a ticket-queue supervisor role. We are looking for an operational leader who understands the economics of dropshipping, protects profit through dispute management, and builds systems that reduce ticket volume while improving customer satisfaction.



If you are metrics-driven, process-oriented, and experienced in multi-brand ecommerce environments, this role is for you.



What You’ll Own

1. Team Leadership & Accountability

-Lead, coach, and develop a remote CS team with clear KPIs

-Drive performance culture through structured QA and feedback

-Implement performance improvement plans when necessary

-Ensure coverage, productivity, and response time targets are consistently met



2. Systems & Operational Excellence



-Fully own and optimize Gorgias (macros, automations, tagging, workflows)

-Build and refine SOPs that reduce inefficiencies and errors

-Improve first-response time, resolution time, CSAT, and refund rates

-Continuously identify automation opportunities to reduce ticket load



3. Performance & Risk Management



-Monitor KPIs daily (AHT, FRT, resolution rate, refund rate, dispute ratio)

-Proactively flag operational risks before they impact revenue

-Deliver structured weekly reports with actionable insights



4. Chargebacks & Disputes



-Oversee disputes across payment platforms

-Maintain a 55%+ win rate

-Strengthen documentation and evidence workflows to protect revenue



What We’re Looking For



-Proven experience managing CS teams across multiple ecommerce brands

-Strong dropshipping background (private label experience is a plus)

-Advanced Gorgias expertise (not basic user level)

-Deep understanding of chargebacks and dispute handling

-Data-driven, objective leadership style

-Strong operational discipline and ownership mindset



Role Details

-Fully remote

-Full-time

-Flexible schedule, but must overlap with core business hours

-Compensation: $6–$10/hour, depending on experience and proven performance



You will have full operational ownership and the opportunity to build a high-performance support structure across multiple brands.

– Understand short-term rental performance metrics (UK market knowledge preferred)

– Can show proven results improving occupancy, ADR, or revenue

– Work independently, identify issues proactively, and present findings clearly



Nice to Have: hands-on PriceLabs experience, experience managing UK-based STR portfolios, structured reporting background



To Apply:

Send a short message and include ORANGE in your title, along with the NUMBER OF YEARS you’ve worked in the short-term rental industry

title: Training, Learning & Automation Specialist
description:
About Bare:



At Bare, we're focused on bringing end-of-life planning into the digital age and, along the way, making a real impact on people at a time in their lives that really matters.



Since launching in 2019 we've grown exponentially. Bare started out as a direct-to-consumer funeral home offering a digitally enabled, low-cost funeral service. We've since expanded to become Australia's leading provider of prepaid funerals, online wills, online estate planning, and pet funerals. Our vision is to become the end-of-life CRM, supporting individuals and families to deal with a difficult topic in an empathic, affordable, and sustainable way.



The exciting part? The journey has only just started. We are backed by some of Australia's highest profile investors, are currently one of the fastest growing companies in Australia, and we're committed to making a difference. Join us on the ground and be intimately involved in the creation and development of a product and service that is category-leading.

The Role:



We’re looking for a Training, Learning & Automation Specialist to design, build and scale our internal learning ecosystem while embedding automation and AI-driven efficiency across training, onboarding and operational workflows.

This is not a traditional L&D role. You’ll sit at the intersection of people, systems, and technology — creating structured learning programs while automating repetitive processes to support a fast-growing, multi-functional team.

You’ll work closely with Operations, Customer Care, Sales, Finance and Leadership to ensure our team is highly trained, efficient, and continuously improving.



Key Responsibilities:



Learning & Development:



-Design and deliver structured onboarding programs across departments (Funeral Arrangers, Sales, Operations, Finance).

-Build scalable e-learning modules, SOP documentation and knowledge libraries.

-Create competency frameworks and capability pathways.

-Facilitate live and virtual training sessions.

-Develop assessment tools to measure skill acquisition and performance uplift.

-Maintain compliance training relevant to Australian funeral and regulatory requirements.



Systems & Automation:



-Identify repetitive manual processes and design automated workflows.

-Implement automation tools (CRM automations, LMS workflows, AI-based support tools).

-Integrate training content into internal systems for seamless adoption.

-Build dashboards to track learning progress, productivity and operational KPIs.

-Collaborate with tech and operations teams to improve internal tooling.





Continuous Improvement:



-Analyse performance data to identify skill gaps.

-Translate operational bottlenecks into structured learning solutions.

-Implement feedback loops to refine training programs.

-Support change management during process or system upgrades.



What Success Looks Like:



-New hires reach full productivity faster.

-Training is systemised, documented and easily scalable.

-Manual tasks are reduced through automation.

-Teams demonstrate measurable performance improvement.

-Leadership has visibility on capability metrics.



About You:



-3+ years in Learning & Development, Enablement, Operations Improvement or similar.

-Experience implementing automation tools (e.g., Zapier, HubSpot workflows, Notion, LMS platforms, AI tools).

-Strong systems thinker who enjoys process optimisation.

-Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment.

-Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

-Highly organised with strong attention to detail.

-Analytical and data-driven in decision making.

-Proactive, solution-oriented and commercially aware.

-Experience in xero, google sheet and CRM (Hubspot) and integrations between systems



Bonus Experience:



-Experience in high-growth startups.

-Experience in regulated industries.

-Familiarity with CRM systems and workflow automation.

-Exposure to AI tools for training and operational efficiency.



Please include your resume in your application.

title: Cold Calling Sales Closer
description:
We are growing our dog accessories division by bringing handcrafted Maasai leather beaded collars to pet lovers and retailers around the world. These collars are made by skilled Maasai artisans in Kenya, combining cultural heritage, premium leather and durable, water-resistant construction. The result is a unique, story-driven product that helps stores stand out and delight their customers.



As a Cold Calling Sales Closer, you own the entire sales cycle on the phone: from first contact with qualified leads to closing initial orders and repeat purchases. You will speak directly with pet retailers, groomers, boarding facilities and importers, present our product, handle objections and secure sales. Your income grows with your results through a monthly salary plus a commission-based structure.



What you will do

- Filter & Call qualified leads from our database and introduce our products.

- Identify quickly if the prospect is a retailer, groomer, boarding facility, vet clinic or importer, and adapt your pitch.

- Present the product clearly: benefits, premium look and in-store positioning.

- Ask targeted questions to understand their business.

- Handle objections  and turn them into opportunities.

- Close sales directly on the call.

- Follow up with warm prospects and turn interest into paid orders.

- Keep accurate notes in the CRM so nothing falls through the cracks.

- Share patterns and feedback with the team to improve scripts, offers and targeting.



We’re not looking for someone who

- Only books meetings and avoids asking for the order.

- Is uncomfortable discussing price or negotiating on the phone.

- Needs a large fixed salary and dislikes performance-based pay.

- Reads scripts word-for-word without listening or adapting.

- Avoids high outbound activity or takes rejection personally.



What’s in it for you

High earning potential through a commission-based model with uncapped upside.

A differentiated, easy-to-love product with a real story behind it.

Direct, visible impact on company growth with clear revenue attribution.

Remote-friendly setup and flexibility to organize your calling blocks.

Growth opportunities into Senior Closer, Key Account or Sales Team Lead.

Preferred experience



Must have

1–3+ years of experience in phone-based sales (telesales, outbound closing, SDR/BDR with closing responsibilities, etc.).

Proven track record of selling directly on calls, not just setting appointments.

Strong bias for action and comfort with daily activity and revenue targets.

Excellent spoken English and a clear, confident phone presence.

Strong listening and objection-handling skills; you are comfortable asking for the sale.

Comfortable with a fixed salary plus commission-based or commission-heavy pay structures.

Solid discipline in using CRM tools and following up.

Good, stable internet connection suitable for VoIP calls and remote work.

Resilience, persistence and a genuine growth mindset.



Nice to have

Experience selling to small businesses in the pet industry (retailers, groomers, vet clinics, distributors).

Experience in international sales or working across time zones.

High tech literacy with sales tools and AI assistants.

Background in sales, customer service or operations where you owned a target.



Recruitment process

Application with short Job requirements testing

Sales interview focused on your past closing experience and results.

Live cold-call simulation with feedback.

Final interview to align on commission structure, targets and ramp-up.

Reference check.

Offer.



We value real skills and real outcomes. If you are not willing to do a short live role-play or share a sample call (even anonymized), this is probably not the right role for you.

title: Amazon Store Management and  Listings & Marketplace Specialist
description:
We’re looking for a highly skilled, detail-oriented Amazon Store Manager & Listing Specialist to take full ownership of our Amazon storefront. This is not just a listing role — you’ll be responsible for building, maintaining, and optimising the entire store presence, ensuring listings rank well, content is compliant and conversion-friendly, and the store performs at its best.

title: SHORT FORM VIDEO EDITOR | Day Shift
description:
We’re hiring someone who knows how to turn long-form content into sharp, high-retention short videos for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is for someone who understands pacing, hooks, and visual rhythm in short-form content, and knows how to edit with intention rather than just cutting clips.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have strong creative instincts and know how to spot 
nts that make people stop scrolling? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a sharp sense of pacing, an instinct for hooks, and a clear understanding of how short-form videos need to flow to hold attention? Do you take pride in clean edits and delivering videos that feel intentional and finished? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Short-Form Editing & Story Selection

- Review long-form videos, transcripts, or raw footage to identify short-form clip opportunities

- Select 
nts that are clear, engaging, and platform-appropriate

- Edit vertical videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

- Create strong hooks, clean cuts, and natural pacing

- Deliver publish-ready videos that meet brand and platform standards



Captions, Visuals & Formatting

- Add on-screen captions (burned-in or SRT as required) with proper timing and readability

- Apply basic motion, zooms, punch-ins, and visual emphasis where appropriate

- Follow platform-specific formatting (aspect ratio, duration, safe margins)



Iteration & Workflow

- Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed turnaround times

- Maintain clear file naming and folder organization

- Track edits, revisions, and delivery status as required



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required

- Strong preference for MacOS users

- Experience editing short-form vertical content for social platforms, required

- Strong understanding of short-form pacing, hooks, and retention

- Experience working from transcripts or long-form content, required

- Clean file organization and understanding of post-production workflo

- Portfolio of completed short-form video projects, required

- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required

- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required

- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required

- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required

- Growth mindset, required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.


 



STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $20-40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Short Form Video Editor with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.
