title: Acquisitions Associate (Property Management)
description:
Role Overview

The Acquisitions Associate is responsible for building and managing Parity’s property acquisition pipeline. This role owns the front end of the development funnel: identifying absentee owners of vacant and distressed properties, maintaining a clean and accurate owner database, conducting outbound outreach, and negotiating purchase terms that align with Parity’s mission and financial parameters. This is a hands-on role that blends data management, outbound communication, negotiation, and coordination with legal and development teams.



Key Responsibilities

1. Acquisition Pipeline & Database Management

• Build, maintain, and continuously clean a database of absentee owners of vacant and distressed properties.

• Aggregate and verify ownership data from public records, tax data, and third-party sources.

• Track owner status, outreach history, responsiveness, and deal stage in Parity’s CRM or database.

• Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency across systems.



2. Owner Outreach & Relationship Management

• Execute outbound outreach campaigns via phone,
, and direct mail.

• Respond to inbound inquiries from property owners.

• Build rapport with owners and clearly communicate Parity’s mission, process, and timelines.

• Maintain consistent follow-up to move owners through the decision-making process.

3. Deal Evaluation & Negotiation

• Conduct preliminary deal screening based on location, condition, and feasibility.

• Negotiate purchase price and basic terms within pre-approved parameters.

• Coordinate property walk-throughs and inspections with internal teams.

• Prepare internal deal summaries and recommendations.

4. Transaction Coordination

• Work closely with legal counsel, title companies, and internal staff through contract and closing.

• Track deal milestones and ensure timely progression to settlement.

• Maintain organized records of contracts, correspondence, and transaction documents.

5. Process Improvement & Reporting

• Help refine acquisition workflows, templates, and outreach scripts.

• Track and report on key metrics such as outreach volume, response rates, conversions, and acquisitions.

• Identify bottlenecks and propose improvements to increase acquisition velocity.



Required Qualifications

• 2–5 years of experience in real estate, acquisitions, development, sales, or a related field.

• Strong organizational skills and comfort managing large datasets.

• Experience with outbound outreach (calls,
s, mail campaigns).

• Demonstrated negotiation skills and comfort having direct financial conversations.

• Clear, professional written and verbal communication.

• High attention to detail and follow-through.

• Experience with property acquisition.

• CRM and database experience (Airtable, HubSpot, etc.).

• Comfort working in a mission-driven, fast-paced environment.



Compensation, Growth, and Benefits

• Competitive compensation commensurate with experience

• Opportunity for performance-based bonuses as the company grows

• Direct mentorship from the founder and CEO

• 21 days of paid time off

title: General Manager
description:
General Manager

Chain Lightning Design & Marketing (CLDM)

Remote | Contractor (Full-Time Equivalent)



About Chain Lightning Design and Marketing (CLDM)

Chain Lightning Design & Marketing is not a traditional agency.

We execute live, high-intensity Design Shows where branding, product, web, and marketing are built in real time. We prioritize 
ntum over bureaucracy, decisions over decks, and outcomes over process.

We move fast.

We iterate live.

We ship in hours — not months.

We are building the operational backbone behind this model.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



The Role



We are hiring a General Manager to become the operational engine of CLDM.

This is not an assistant role.

This is not a task-runner role.

You will build systems, enforce standards, recruit elite talent, track performance metrics, and help architect the company’s internal structure from the ground up.

You will work directly with the Director/Orchestrator and will grow into a leadership position with authority across recruiting, documentation, analytics, and operations.

This role requires independence, speed, and judgment.

Many processes are still being refined. You must be comfortable operating inside ambiguity and turning chaos into clarity.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



What You Will Be Responsible For



- Talent & Recruiting

- Source and recruit high-performance contractors (PH preferred)

- Schedule and coordinate group interviews weekly

- Build hiring funnels and screening systems

- Track candidate quality metrics

- Continuously upgrade team performance



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Operations & Organization



- Plan and schedule Design Shows

- Coordinate production team participation

- Track hours worked and rehearsal participation

- Maintain internal workflow systems (ClickUp / Notion / Sheets)

- Ensure deadlines are hit without excuses



Analytics & Performance Tracking

- Track KPIs across Design Shows

- Analyze production output efficiency

- Identify best and worst performers

- Produce weekly operational reports

- Help refine bonus and incentive systems



Documentation & SOP Management

- Maintain and update internal SOPs

- Document new processes immediately

- Record and transcribe meetings

- Systemize repeatable workflows



Financial & Administrative

- Track contractor hours

- Calculate payroll & bonuses

- Assist with operational cost analysis

- Review contracts and documentation for clarity



Design Show Support

- Assist as Co-Orchestrator during live sessions

- Build mood boards and presentation decks

- Troubleshoot technical issues

- Maintain production visibility during live events



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 



Non-Negotiable Core Traits



- You must naturally be:

- Self-directed (no hand holding)

- Highly organized

- Fast under pressure

- Analytical and data-driven

- Comfortable giving constructive pushback

- Action-oriented

- Growth-minded

- Decisive

- Operationally disciplined

- Strong communicator (written & verbal)



If you wait for instructions, this role is not for you.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Technical Requirements



- Google Suite (Docs, Sheets, Slides)

- Excel / Advanced spreadsheets

- Slack

- Figma (basic familiarity required)

- AI tools (ChatGPT, transcription tools, analytics tools)



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Bonus:



Experience managing remote contractors

- Startup experience

- Performance-based incentive systems

- Recruiting experience in Philippines market



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Who This Is Perfect For



- Someone who wants to build a company, not just work in one

- Someone who thrives in early-stage growth environments

- Someone who enjoys building systems from scratch

- Someone who wants real authority and upward trajectory



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Growth Path



- This role will evolve into:

- Head of Operations

- Chief of Staff

- Director of Talent

- Or strategic leadership role within CLDM





Compensation and authority scale with company growth and performance.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Final Note



CLDM is intense.

We move fast.

We expect excellence.

If you want a slow, comfortable role — this isn’t it.

If you want to help build a new operating model for branding and marketing — apply.

title: Sales Representative
description:
Join a fast-growing US online home goods retailer and enjoy the learning and opportunities that you have while working with us.



We strive to provide 5-star service & shopping assistance to all of our clients, and all of our team is accountable to fulfill this.



We are looking for a Sales Representative who can assist prospective buyers and close online ecommerce sales.



We're only looking for full-time, long-term, ongoing cooperation.



Work schedules available:

8 AM to 4 PM US EST

4 PM to 12 AM US EST



Your work week will be 5 days per week, with 2 days off per week. Days off will be selected with your manager. We will try to accommodate your preferences for which days you like, based on availability.



This role starts ASAP.



Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Receive incoming phone calls and live chats from potential customers (prospects) who indicated that they need shopping assistance. This does not include calls and chats from existing customers that need help with their orders (that’s a job for a different department)

Makes follow-up calls, writes follow-up
s, and text messages to potential buyers. We try to follow up 5x with each person that contacted us (unless they indicate that they are no longer interested). We don’t do cold calling. Only reaching out to prospects who interacted with our online store and left their contact information.

After each interaction with a prospect/customer, writes notes & comments in our CRM (Asana)

Communicate efficiently and build rapport with potential customers

Assists prospects in their shopping journey and helps make the purchase decision

Ensures that all prospects’ questions and objections are addressed

Leads every interaction to a close sale, which means an order is placed on our online store

Prepares custom quotes, price matches competitors if necessary, and offers custom discounts. This requires calculating margins & ensuring profitability.

Answering questions about the products we offer, including technical questions. Learns the specifications, features and benefits of our bestsellers. Over time, becomes an expert in the industry.

If not able to answer product-specific questions, conducts research in the materials provided by the supplier, or reaches out to the supplier to get the information

Confirms stock availability and lead times when offering products to prospects

Documents standard procedures and best practices in a written form, so that other tea
mbers can learn from them



Requirements:

At least 2 years of experience in sales on the phone

Experience must include both inbound and outbound sales

Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

Experience in Customer Service on the phone is a nice to have

Experience in the e-commerce (online shopping) industry is nice to have

Home improvement, construction, and gas plumbing industry experience is a plus

Outgoing, friendly, and lively

Can-do mindset, with a sense of ownership, pride in your performance, and its impact on the company’s success

Long-term commitment - treat this as your career



What we can offer:

Sales commission: 8% of gross profit from all orders closed. Gross profit means the sale amount minus the product and shipping costs. Paid monthly. No upper limit. Monthly commission payouts range between $1,200 (the guaranteed minimum) and as high as $3,000 (for the top performer). The average monthly payout is $1,465 (average from the last 2 years).

$1,200/month minimum guaranteed pay

15 days paid days off per year (also convertible to min. guaranteed commission)

Paid training on all aspects of the role

Opportunities for professional development

Friendly atmosphere

Online Interview process

Fully remote position

title: Splunk Engineer
description:
Senior Splunk Platform Engineer (Enterprise, ITSI & ES)

Role Summary



Design, implement, and maintain enterprise-scale Splunk Enterprise environments supporting ITSI (Observability) and Enterprise Security (SIEM) use cases. Responsible for architecture, ingestion engineering, performance optimization, and security monitoring reliability.



Core Responsibilities

Architect and support distributed Splunk environments (Indexer Cluster, SHC, HFs).

Engineer and troubleshoot data ingestion (props, transforms, index routing).

Design and optimize metrics and event pipelines.

Build and tune ITSI services, KPIs, and health models.

Configure and optimize ES correlation searches and notable events.

Maintain CIM compliance and data model acceleration.

Diagnose parsing vs indexing issues and cluster replication problems.

Enforce RBAC, governance, and platform stability.



Core Skillset

Splunk Enterprise architecture & clustering

Splunk IT Service Intelligence service modeling & KPIs

Splunk Enterprise Security correlation & threat detection

Advanced props/transforms configuration

Metrics & log-to-metrics engineering

Performance tuning & troubleshooting

automation

title: Senior Shopify Catalog & Product Data Specialist
description:
This role is best suited for someone who genuinely enjoys working with structured data, catching mistakes others miss, and building clean Shopify catalogs with precision.



We’re a Canadian eCommerce agency working with luxury fashion and accessories brands across North America. Our clients trust us to manage structured, high-volume Shopify catalogs with precision and consistency.



This is not a basic data entry role.

We are hiring someone experienced in building and importing structured Shopify product data at scale.



Key Responsibilities



• Build and launch large product catalogs in Shopify from purchase orders, buy sheets, and vendor files

• Structure complex variants, SKUs, tags, collections, and metafields

• Create and clean Shopify import spreadsheets with accuracy

• Perform bulk edits, imports/exports, and catalog audits

• Maintain pricing, imagery, and variant logic

• Communicate proactively during PST working hours



Requirements



• Strong Shopify backend experience

• Advanced Google Sheets or Excel skills (formulas required)

• Experience managing large SKU counts

• Excellent attention to detail

• Strong English communication

• Fashion or retail experience preferred



Compensation



• 42,000 PHP per month ($1,000 CAD)

• Paid bi-weekly

• 40 hours per week

• 9:30 AM – 5:00 PM PST availability required

• Long-term role with growth potential





To Apply (Read Carefully)



Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.



Please submit:

1. Cover letter + résumé

Include examples of Shopify catalog work and approximate SKU volume managed.



2. Completed Test Task (approx. 10–15 minutes):

Open this Google Sheet:



• One tab shows a Purchase Order

• One tab shows a draft import sheet (contains errors)

Create a NEW Google Sheet and rebuild the import correctly.

Share the link (Editor access enabled) and list the mistakes you found and corrected.



3. 1–2 minute video introduction (Google Drive or YouTube link) explaining:

• Your Shopify catalog experience

• Your spreadsheet skill level

• Why you’re a strong fit for a precision-focused role



We review every application manually. Incomplete submissions will not be considered.

title: Senior  Designer & Editor
description:
We’re seeking a Senior Motion Designer & Editor to create high-quality, story-driven motion graphics and video content across digital, social, paid media, and broadcast platforms. This is a part-time role for a detail-oriented, technically strong professional who can lead projects from concept to final delivery.



Key Responsibilities

* Lead the concept, design, and execution of motion graphics and video content

* Edit footage into dynamic, story-driven sequences, integrating rhythm, pacing, and music

* Deliver content across multiple formats and platforms, including broadcast-ready outputs

* Partner with producers to manage the full production lifecycle from raw footage to final delivery

* Ensure all work meets brand, creative, and technical standards

* Collaborate with creative teams and clients, integrating feedback efficiently

* Explore new tools and AI-assisted workflows to improve creative output

* Support creative leadership and contribute positively to studio culture



Must-Have Skills & Experience



Core Tools

* Adobe After Effects – motion graphics, animation, compositing

* Adobe Premiere Pro – video editing, sequencing, finishing

* Adobe Photoshop – image manipulation and asset prep

* Adobe Illustrator – vector artwork, titles, graphic elements



Video & Production Expertise

* End-to-end video production workflows, from raw footage to final output

* Exporting across multiple formats and resolutions

* Audio syncing, pacing, and music-driven editing



Collaboration & Workflow

* Familiarity with project planning and production tools

* Strong feedback integration and digital collaboration skills



AI & Emerging Tools

* Experience using AI-assisted tools for motion design, editing, or workflow efficiency



Nice to Have

* DaVinci Resolve

* 3D motion design workflows



Who Will Thrive in This Role

* You have strong visual storytelling instincts and creative leadership experience

* You are detail-driven, technically strong, and can deliver across multiple platforms

* You adapt quickly, problem-solve effectively, and collaborate well with teams

* You are excited to experiment with new tools and AI workflows to elevate production quality

title: Virtual Assistant
description:
About Stellata Partners

Stellata Partners is a private investment firm focused on middle-market investment opportunities in the United States. Stellata Partners is run by an alumnus from Harvard Business School with experience in investment banking and private equity across a variety of industries. We operate in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment and work closely with leadership day-to-day.



Role Overview

We’re hiring a Virtual Assistant (VA) to support proprietary deal sourcing efforts and general administrative needs. You’ll be a key execution partner for:

• List building for outbound campaigns

• Contact enrichment and data hygiene

• Cold calling and follow-up

• General VA operations support (scheduling, research, light admin)



You’ll work directly with the Founder/Managing Partner and help keep the sourcing engine running smoothly.



Key Responsibilities



1) Cold Calling + Follow-Up (Primary)

• Place outbound calls to business owners and executives using provided scripts and talk tracks

• Qualify leads and capture structured notes (business profile, ownership intent, timing, objections)

• Route interested prospects to the next step (calendar scheduling, intro
, information request)

• Maintain high professionalism and compliance with calling best practices and internal guidelines



2) General Virtual Assistant Support (Secondary)

• Inbox triage support (labeling, routing, drafting basic replies for review)

• Scheduling and coordination (calls, reminders, follow-up cadences)

• Light operations tasks and ad hoc projects to keep workflows organized



Qualifications

• Prior experience in sourcing, outreach, or pipeline/CRM support, ideally supporting a search fund or investment firm workflow

• Instantly/Smartlead, 
, HubSpot, Pipedrive, or Airtable

• Microsoft Excel and Outlook proficiency

• Comfortable making cold calls to U.S. business owners and handling objections with professionalism

• Strong attention to detail and high quality standards in data work

• Highly organized and reliable with deadlines, task tracking, and follow-through

• Excellent spoken and written English (fluency required)

• Please mention if you are from an English speaking country such as Belize or South Africa. 



What We Are Looking For 

• Comfort working in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment 

• Proactive mindset and initiative-taking attitude 

• Ability to learn quickly and take feedback 

• Consistent high-quality performance and keen attention to detail 

• Strong analytical, research, and communication capabilities 



Schedule: Part-time or full-time (based on fit); ability to overlap with U.S. Central Time (CT) is a plus



Note: In your message, please include a list of all lead generation/sourcing tools and databases that you 1) currently have access to and 2) do not have access to but have experience using in prior roles. Also please include a link to proof of your english speaking abilities.

title: Senior Social Media & Marketing Manager (D2C E-commerce Coffee Brand) *Full Time | Remote (Asia Time Zone)
description:
Innovative global coffee brand inventing one-of-a-kind tools redefining how coffee is experienced. Seeking a Marketing Manager to own campaigns, launches, and cross-channel execution alongside founders.





ABOUT ICOSA BREWHOUSE:

ICOSA Brewhouse is a globally recognized specialty coffee brand redefining how coffee is experienced. We are shaping coffee culture around the world. (
  / 
 )



We design and invent one-of-a-kind tools that didn’t exist before — tools that elevate everyday rituals and introduce new ways of enjoying coffee.



From record-breaking Kickstarter launches to collaborations with world-class coffee professionals, our products are used by champions, in top cafés, and in homes in 100+ countries around the world. 



We are a design-led, innovation-driven brand operating in a niche we are actively shaping. We build thoughtfully, test deliberately, and care deeply about quality — in both product and execution.



As we continue to innovate, launch new products, and grow, we are looking for a Senior Social Media & Marketing Manager to take ownership of how our work is brought to life across channels.



You won’t just publish content.



You’ll help shape how new products are introduced, how campaigns are structured, and how our global community experiences our brand — while ensuring execution remains disciplined, consistent, and scalable.







YOUR ROLE AND OPPORTUNITY ON THE TEAM:

This is a senior marketing operator role. Execution is central — but it is not a junior content posting role.



You will work directly with our Marketing Lead to:

• Own day-to-day marketing delivery across core channels

• Structure and execute campaigns from planning through rollout

• Translate ideas into clear, executable briefs

• Coordinate creative production across internal, outsourced, and AI-assisted workflows

• Strengthen how our marketing engine operates over time



You will see early product prototypes.

You will contribute to campaign discussions before launch.

You will help shape how innovation is presented to a global audience.



Execution is central to this role — but so is judgment, ownership, and the ability to think in campaigns rather than isolated posts.





What you’ll own:



(1) Marketing Execution Across Channels

• Own social media execution (Instagram and
).

• Plan and manage content calendars aligned with brand positioning.

• Ensure consistent publishing and follow-through across platforms.

• Manage inbox and community engagement, including partnership or influencer communication if required.

• Execute
 campaigns aligned with launches, promotions, and collaborations.



You ensure marketing execution remains structured, timely, and dependable.



(2) Campaign Rollout & Launch Execution

• Support and execute seasonal campaigns, product launches, collaborations, and promotional initiatives.

• Translate marketing objectives into structured creative briefs.

• Coordinate creative asset development across designers, freelancers, and AI-supported workflows.

• Oversee cohesive cross-channel rollout so messaging, visuals, and timing align across social,
, and paid efforts.

• Strengthen campaign structure and rollout processes over time.



You think in campaigns — not just content pieces.



(3) Creative Briefing & Quality Control

• Create clear, structured briefs for design and content production.

• Maintain high standards of aesthetic consistency, messaging clarity, and brand voice integrity across both human and AI-assisted workflows.

• Draft copy or guide AI-assisted content creation when needed, ensuring outputs remain on-brand and high quality.

• Review creative outputs for brand alignment before escalation to the Marketing Lead.

• Collaborate comfortably in tools such as Figma or similar platforms to support execution and alignment.



You don’t need to be a designer — but you should have strong creative judgment.



(4) Growth & Operational Development

• Identify opportunities to refine workflows and strengthen how our marketing engine operates.

• Lead or contribute to structured testing and rollout of new channels or initiatives as capacity allows.

• Over time, take increasing ownership of campaign structuring, cross-channel coordination, partnership campaign oversight, and creative alignment across performance-driven efforts.



As you demonstrate reliability and judgment, your scope expands meaningfully.





What success looks like:

• Social and
 channels operate smoothly with consistent execution and strong brand alignment.

• Campaigns are rolled out in a coordinated, cross-channel manner without last-minute chaos.

• Creative briefs are structured, clear, and reduce friction across collaborators.

• Marketing execution no longer bottlenecks leadership attention.

• Early experiments in new channels or initiatives are tested in a structured way.



Over time, you become a trusted execution leader within the marketing team.





What This Role Is Not:

• Not a pure content creator role.

• Not a brand strategist role.

• Not a paid media buyer role.

• Not an administrative coordinator role.



This is a senior marketing operator position inside a growing global brand.







ABOUT YOU / WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

You are someone who:

• Understands how structured marketing campaigns come together.

• Can translate ideas into clear execution plans.

• Is comfortable owning delivery without hand-holding.

• Is comfortable reviewing performance data and using insights to inform execution decisions.

• Is strategic enough to think ahead — but practical enough to execute consistently.



You are strategic enough to think ahead — but practical enough to execute consistently.



Must have skills or experience:

• 4–6+ years of experience managing marketing and/or social for a brand.

• Experience executing structured marketing campaigns.

• Experience within D2C or product-based brands strongly preferred.

• Comfortable operating inside e-commerce environments.

• Highly detail-oriented and disciplined in follow-through.

• Strong creative judgment and ability to assess content quality and brand alignment.

• Comfort collaborating in design tools such as Figma.

• Comfortable working directly with founders in a small, fast-moving team.



Big pluses:

• Experience supporting product launches or crowdfunding campaigns.

• Experience creating, implementing, and refining marketing processes or building SOPs.

• Experience coordinating freelancers or creative collaborators.

• Familiarity with Klaviyo or similar
 platforms.

• Exposure to AI-assisted marketing workflows.







WHY JOIN US:

At ICOSA Brewhouse, you will:

• Work directly with founders who are deeply involved in product design, positioning, and global campaigns.

• Operate close to innovation — seeing products and launches before they are introduced to the world.

• Contribute to campaigns that reach a global coffee audience.

• Have real ownership inside a small, high-performing team where your work is visible and impactful.

• Help shape coffee culture around the world.



We are a fully remote team — but we operate with structure and discipline.



You’ll be joining a close-knit group focused on building something meaningful with collaboration and accountability. There is no office politics. No unnecessary hierarchy. Just people committed to high standards.



We care deeply about growth — not just as a company, but as individuals. As we expand, there are real opportunities to take on broader ownership, lead initiatives, and shape how our marketing evolves.



If you want a role where:

• Your ideas are heard.

• Your execution matters.

• Your scope can grow with your capability.

You will feel at home here.







COMPENSATION AND WORKING STRUCTURE

Full time: 40 hours/week 

Compensation range: $1,100-$1,800 (based on relevant experience and demonstrated capability)

Up to 16 days of paid time off annually

Asia time zone working hours required







HOW TO APPLY

Are you ready? 



If you’d like to join us on our journey and grow together with us, we’re looking forward to meeting you.



We understand you may have a busy schedule, so we’ve made our application process extremely efficient. 



To apply, please follow the steps below:

1. Complete the quick application: 
 

2. In the first question of the application start it with: "I’m (insert your name) from (insert your city/town) and my favourite food is (insert your favourite food). Then introduce yourself and why you think you’ll be a good fit for this position. 

3. We’ll be in touch with next steps for the interview once we receive it. 



We look forward to reviewing your application.

Take rough ideas and scripts and turn them into persuasive visual stories



Requirements:

You MUST have experience in creating VSL videos for dropshipping/e-commerce

Strong understanding of direct response video structure (hook -> problem -> solution -> CTA)

Ability to translate and localize content fast with tools and AI

Detail-obsessed: no subtitle misalignments, no poor syncing, no off-looking visuals



Must know how to:



•?  ?Use ElevenLabs

•?  ?Edit with any video editing software

•?  ?Use MidJourney for AI image generation

•?  ?Create AI voiceovers (ARC ads style)

•?  ?Find viral clips on TikTok, Instagram, YouTube



What we offer you:

title: Part-Time Meta Ads Operator (Execution Focused)
description:
About Us

We’re a programming education company that helps experienced software engineers build real-world Rust projects and land Rust roles. We run a high-ticket, cohort-based accelerator plus self-paced training, and reach engineers through YouTube,
, and partnerships.



Role Overview

We are looking for a part-time Meta Ads Operator to implement and maintain our
 and Instagram campaigns. This is an execution-focused role: you will take clear targeting and creative direction from the founder and marketing team, then handle setup, tracking, and ongoing optimizations inside Meta Ads Manager.



Ideal for someone who enjoys clean accounts, accurate tracking, and making data-driven tweaks, not sitting in branding meetings.



Key Responsibilities

1. Implement and maintain Meta Pixel and Conversion API across our funnels (waitlist, applications, bookings, purchases).

2. Set up campaigns, ad sets, and ads according to provided specs (objectives, budgets, audiences, and creatives).

3. Create and manage custom and lookalike audiences from our traffic,
 list, and engaged users.

4. Monitor performance daily on weekdays and execute simple rules: pause obvious losers, keep winners within defined guardrails, and flag issues quickly.

5. Run basic A/B tests on creatives and audiences following our testing framework.

6. Ensure tracking events fire correctly on all key steps and troubleshoot when they do not.

7. Produce a concise weekly report (spend, cost per waitlist opt-in, cost per application, cost per call, cost per student) with 2 to 3 clear recommendations.



You Are A Good Fit If

1. You have 1 to 3 years of hands-on experience running Meta Ads (lead gen or info/education experience is a plus).

2. You are comfortable with Meta Ads Manager, Pixel, standard events, and basic CAPI.

3. You can read numbers and make simple performance-based decisions without drama.

4. You are organized, responsive, and document what you do so others can follow it.

5. You can overlap at least 2 to 3 hours per day with US time zones.

6. You’re currently freelancing or working part?time and want a long?term core client, not just a one?off project.



This Role Is Not

1. Not a creative director or copywriter (we have a content and
 team).

2. Not a CMO or growth strategist d
 offers, funnels, or pricing.

3. Not a general social media manager (no organic posting, community management, or influencer work).



Scope & Engagement

1. Part-time contractor.

2. We’ll start at 5–10 hours/week for the first 60–90 days while we validate and scale Meta.

3. We guarantee a minimum of 20 hours/month, paid monthly, so your time is predictable.

4. If performance is strong and we scale ad spend, this role can grow into 15–20+ hours/week and potentially a full-time PH position.

5. Remote, flexible schedule as long as SLAs are met and campaigns are monitored on weekdays.



How To Apply



Please reply to this job post with the following:

1. A brief summary of your Meta Ads experience, including typical monthly budgets.

2. Screenshots or summaries of 2 to 3 campaigns you have managed (goal, budget, structure, and results).

3. One paragraph on how you normally set up tracking (pixel, events, CAPI) for a lead gen funnel.

4. Your part-time hourly rate and full-time monthly rate, respectively.

title: SEO Specialist (Singapore Market Focus – Home Improvement)
description:
Company Overview – 338aircon.sg



338aircon.sg is a Singapore-based air-conditioning service provider specializing in installation, servicing, repair, and maintenance for residential and commercial properties. Operating in Singapore’s highly competitive home improvement market, the company is focused on building strong organic visibility, dominating local search results, and ranking **Top 3 for high-intent home improvement keywords in Singapore**.



This is a long-term role for an SEO professional who deeply understands the Singapore market and can consistently deliver measurable organic growth.



---



Role Objective



Your primary goal is to rank our business in the Top 3 Google search results for priority Singapore home improvement and aircon-related keywords, driving qualified leads and sustainable organic traffic.



Only candidates with proven Singapore SEO experience will be considered.



---



Key Responsibilities



* Develop and execute SEO strategies **specifically targeting the Singapore market**

* Conduct **Singapore-focused keyword research** (local intent, service-based searches)

* Optimize website content, landing pages, and service pages for conversions

* Perform technical SEO audits and coordinate fixes with developers

* Build **high-quality, locally relevant backlinks** within the home improvement industry

* Manage and optimize **Google Search Console & Google Analytics**

* Optimize **Google Business Profile** for Singapore local SEO dominance

* Track rankings, traffic, and conversions; deliver **monthly performance reports**

* Recommend content strategies aligned with **Singapore search intent and buyer behavior**



---



Requirements (Strict)



* **Minimum 2–3 years proven SEO experience**

* **Direct, hands-on experience handling a Singapore-based company (REQUIRED)**

* Strong understanding of **local SEO in Singapore**

* Solid experience in **on-page, off-page, and technical SEO**

* Proficiency with SEO tools

* Ability to analyze data and translate it into **actionable strategies**

* Strong written English skills



---



Strong Advantages

* Experience in **home improvement, renovation, aircon, property, or service-based industries**

* Proven success ranking businesses in **competitive Singapore local markets**

* Familiarity with **Singapore consumer behavior and search patterns**

* Basic knowledge of **conversion rate optimization (CRO)**



---



Compensation



* **Competitive salary** (based on experience and results)

* **Long-term engagement** with performance-based growth opportunities



---



How to Apply



Please submit the following:



1. **Updated resume**

2. **Portfolio or case studies** of Singapore-based SEO projects

3. **Sample results** (ranking improvements, traffic growth, lead generation)

4. **Expected monthly salary (in PHP)**

5. A brief outline of your SEO strategy for a Singapore home improvement company aiming for Top 3 rankings



---



**Important Notice**

**Only applicants with verified Singapore market SEO experience will be considered.**



We are looking for a **results-driven SEO professional** ready to grow long-term with **338 Aircon SG** and our partner brands.

- Learns quickly and adapts to new tools

 platforms

Why Join Us

We are serious about growth.



We invest in our team and provide free monthly learning from the start. We believe that if you improve your skills, our company improves too.



This role is designed for someone who wants long term stability, skill development and increasing responsibility over time.



If you also have experience with Adobe Suite or related tools, we can help you develop those skills further.



Work Details:

- Full time position

- Monday to Friday

- Australia time zone

- Flexible working hours



At least one hour overlap for tea
etings (not every day)



After your 6 month probation:

- 13th month pay

- Sick leave

- 1 vacation leave and 3 sick leaves

- We honour most Filipino holidays except All Saints and All Souls Day

- Salary is negotiable based on skill and experience.



How To Apply.



Use the subject line:

“I’m a creative web developer”



Include your portfolio and examples of Elementor sites you have built.



We are looking for someone who wants to grow with us, not just complete tasks.

title: Graphic Designer/Wordpress Website Builder
description:
Graphic Designer & Web Designer (Adobe + WordPress)



Location: Remote / Hybrid

Type: Part-Time / Full-Time / Contract (Customize as needed)



Position Overview



We are looking for a creative and detail-oriented Graphic Designer with Web Design experience to join our team. This role requires strong visual design skills combined with hands-on experience building and maintaining websites using WordPress, Elementor, and Divi.



The ideal candidate understands branding, layout, typography, user experience, and knows how to translate ideas into polished digital and print designs.



Key Responsibilities



Graphic Design



* Create branded graphics for social media, websites, print materials, and marketing campaigns

* Design logos, brand elements, and visual identity systems

* Develop marketing assets including flyers, brochures, digital ads, and
 graphics

* Ensure consistency across all brand visuals

* Prepare files for print and digital production



Web Design & Development



* Design and build custom WordPress websites

* Work confidently with Elementor and Divi

* Customize themes and layouts to match brand identity

* Optimize websites for user experience and mobile responsiveness

* Update and maintain website content as needed

* Troubleshoot layout or design issues



Required Skills & Experience



* Proficient in Adobe Illustrator

* Proficient in Adobe Photoshop

* Strong understanding of typography, color theory, and layout principles

* Experience building websites in WordPress

* Advanced working knowledge of Elementor

* Experience using Divi theme builder

* Understanding of responsive design and mobile optimization

* Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines

* Strong communication and collaboration skills



Preferred (Nice to Have)



* Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS

* Experience with branding strategy

* Understanding of SEO fundamentals

* Experience designing for service-based businesses

* Video editing or motion graphics experience (optional)



What We’re Looking For



* A designer who thinks strategically, not just visually

* Someone who understands how design supports marketing and growth

* A proactive communicator

* Organized and deadline-driven

* Creative but able to follow brand guidelines



How to Apply



Please submit:

* Resume

* Portfolio showcasing graphic and web design projects

* 2–3 WordPress websites you’ve built (specify if Elementor or Divi)

* Brief description of your design process

title: Kitchen & Interior Designer
description:
Hi — I’m the owner of a Bay Area design-build firm specializing in high-end kitchens and luxury residential remodels. I’m looking for a talented designer with a strong eye for composition, proportion, and materials — not just someone who can place cabinets.







This role is ideal for a designer who:







• Thinks like a designer, not a drafter



• Understands space planning, balance, and visual hierarchy



• Can translate inspiration into refined, buildable designs



• Is confident with kitchens, storage, and interior layouts



• Is highly detail-oriented and organized







What you’ll work on:



• Luxury kitchens & interior spaces



• Concept development & layout refinement



• Elevations, visuals, and presentation drawings



• Collaborative design iterations







Tools:



Experience with 2020 Design and 3CAD is important, but design ability matters far more than software speed.



Important:



I value creativity, taste, and problem-solving. This is not a production drafting role. Portfolio quality is the key factor.





If interested, please send:





• Portfolio (very important)



• Brief background / experience



• Software proficiency







Looking forward to seeing your work.

title: Graphic Designer.
description:
Overview



We are not looking for a traditional graphic designer.



We are looking for someone who understands how to build visual systems at scale using AI tools and can turn large volumes of AI-generated assets into cohesive, high-performing products and brand visuals.



This role sits between design, AI workflows, and production execution.



You will not be creating everything manually. You will be directing, refining, and systemizing AI-generated outputs so they look professional, consistent, and commercially effective.



This is a probationary role initially. We are looking for proven capability, not theory.



What You Will Actually Do



• Own visual consistency across products, marketing, and digital assets.

• Build reusable visual styles and frameworks that teams can follow.

• Improve AI-generated outputs through design judgment, prompting refinement, and layout decisions.

• Work with AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, Midjourney/SDXL/ComfyUI-style workflows, etc.).

• Guide teams on composition, brand alignment, and visual hierarchy.

• Convert raw AI outputs into polished, conversion-ready assets.

• Help scale production without sacrificing quality.



What This Role Is NOT



• Not a junior designer role.

• Not someone making random Canva graphics.

• Not someone who only knows traditional design software without AI workflow experience.

• Not someone who needs heavy direction.



Ideal Candidate Profile



• Strong visual taste and commercial design judgment.

• Experience working with AI-generated assets.

• Understands how to reduce visual drift and maintain consistency at scale.

• Can think in systems, not just single images.

• Comfortable working in fast, high-output environments.

• Bonus: motion/animation experience for short-form content.



How Success Will Be Measured



• Visual consistency improves across products and platforms.

• AI outputs require less rework.

• Product designs feel cohesive and brand-aligned.

• Teams move faster because design direction is clear.



Screening Questions (Required — No Exceptions)



1. What visual or production problem did you encounter in a real project?

Explain the problem clearly.



2. What did you personally do to fix it?

Describe your process, decisions, and tools used (especially AI tools if applicable).



3. Show the result.

Provide before/after examples or links and explain how your work improved outcomes (quality, consistency, speed, or performance).



Important



We are looking for builders and problem-solvers, not portfolio-only designers.



If you cannot clearly explain your thinking process and show measurable improvement from your work, this role is not a fit.

title: Senior Local SEO and Google Business Profile Specialist
description:
Full Time Career Role With Performance Incentives



We are not hiring a task worker.



We are hiring a performance driven Local SEO specialist who understands rankings, traffic, and conversions.



If you are confident in your SEO ability and want to work inside a growth focused environment, keep reading.



Who This Role Is For



Before we dive in, you can work 9 to 5 hours, not USA or UK times! 



This role is for someone who:

- Has proven Local SEO experience

- Understands Google Business Profile optimisation beyond basic posting

- Can analyse SERPs and explain ranking differences

- Thinks strategically, not just tactically

- Wants long term stability instead of freelance instability



If you are still learning the basics of SEO, this role is not for you.



What You Will Own



You will take responsibility for improving local rankings and visibility for real client campaigns. But you will receive support and training.



Your responsibilities will include:

- Advanced keyword research and search intent mapping

- Competitive SERP breakdown and ranking opportunity analysis

- Google Business Profile optimisation strategy

- Content gap and topical authority planning

- Backlink prospecting with quality evaluation

- Weekly SEO publishing with full on page optimisation

- Internal linking architecture

- Search Console performance analysis

- Google Analytics reporting insights

- Identifying conversion opportunities

- You will improve performance.



Minimum Requirements

You must:

- Have at least 3 to 5 years of hands on SEO experience

- Be able to explain how you improved rankings in a previous role

- Understand Local SEO ranking factors

- Know how to analyse competitors using SEO tools

- Be fluent in English



Experience with WordPress is required.



If you cannot confidently explain what affects local rankings, do not apply.



Tools and Technical Comfort



You should already be comfortable using:

- Google Search Console

- Google Analytics

- Google Business Profile

- SEO research tools

- Google Docs and Sheets

- Microsoft Office



Basic understanding of Tag Manager is preferred.



What You Get In Return

- Full time stability

- Philippine working hours

- Structured KPIs

- Performance bonuses

- Profit share potential

- Ongoing SEO training

- Exposure to real campaigns, not theory

- Sick leave

- One day off monthly

- Weekly training 



This is a long term position for someone who wants to grow into a senior SEO strategist.



How To Apply

At the very top of your message, write:



“I love SEO”



We are looking for someone serious about SEO, not someone looking for side work.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Administrative & Data Operations Assistant (Renewable Energy Projects)



Location: Remote

Employment Type: Full-Time

Schedule Requirement: Must be willing to work during U.S. Mountain Time (MT) business hours



Position Overview



We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Administrative & Data Operations Assistant to support our renewable energy development team. This role is primarily administrative and operational, focused on coordinating data, preparing documentation, conducting research, and supporting internal workflows that help move projects forward.



This is a dynamic position where responsibilities may vary depending on project timelines and business demand. The selected candidate will also provide administrative support to specific projects and teams as needed.



Key Responsibilities



The role includes, but is not limited to, the following administrative and coordination tasks:



1. Land & Parcel Research Support



Collect and organize parcel information provided by outreach teams.

Research property details using tools such as Regrid, LandGlide, and County Assessor websites.

Verify ownership, acreage, and location information.

Maintain accurate records in internal databases (TerraVault and CRM platforms).

Coordinate GIS requests for mapping and site evaluation.



2. Data Management & System Updates



Upload, validate, and maintain project data across internal systems.

Clean and prepare datasets for bulk uploads.

Organize parcel groupings and ensure proper project classification.

Ensure records remain structured, accurate, and up to date.



3. Proposal & Documentation Coordination



Prepare proposal-related documentation based on project team instructions.

Update financial inputs and generate summaries for review.

Coordinate document workflows between internal systems and document platforms.

Assist with revisions and finalization of proposal packages.



4. Administrative Support for Landowner Engagement



Prepare digital and physical proposal packets.

Coordinate mailing requests and logistics when required.

Track consultation bookings and update internal records.

Ensure documents align with requested terms and project updates.



5. Market & Land Comparable Research



Conduct research using platforms such as Zillow, Redfin, Lands of America, Land and Farm, and AcreValue.

Compile comparison data and summarize findings for internal review.



6. Campaign & Project Data Uploading



Support outreach and mailing campaigns by reviewing and uploading datasets.

Validate data prior to import to maintain quality control.

Assist in onboarding new project targets into company systems.



7. Cross-Functional & Project-Based Administrative Support



Provide administrative assistance to internal teams for specific projects as needed.

Coordinate with GIS, Outreach, Projects, and Leadership teams to ensure workflow progress.



Track tasks, follow-ups, and documentation to help projects stay on schedule.





**Nature of the Role



This is not a routine clerical role. The position requires:

Managing structured processes while adapting to changing business needs.

Supporting multiple teams depending on active projects.

Handling a mix of research, coordination, documentation, and system updates.

Being flexible and responsive as priorities shift.



**Qualifications



At least 2 years of experience in an administrative, data support, operations, or similar role.

Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.

Ability to manage multiple tasks and shifting priorities.

Comfortable working with spreadsheets, databases, and online research tools.

Strong written communication and documentation abilities.

Self-directed and able to work remotely with minimal supervision.

Highly willing and able to work during U.S. Mountain Time hours (required).



**Preferred (but not required):



Experience in real estate, land research, GIS coordination, or renewable energy.

Familiarity with CRM or database systems.

Experience supporting project-based teams.



IMPORTANT:



Application Instructions (Important)

To apply, please complete the following steps:



1. Click the Google Form link provided in this job post and complete the application form.


/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScq1I6o7JPiy-ds_KtkbznAcTENzQd_XTHHQBUsmASrWD7qpA/viewform?usp=dialog



2. After submitting the form, send a message through this platform using the format below:



Format:

[Position Applying For] – [Full Name] – [Application Date]



Example:

Administrative Assistant – Steve Jone – February 18, 2026



**Applications that do not follow these instructions may not be reviewed.**



Only shortlisted will be contacted.

title: Operations & Account Manager (U.S. Security – 24/7 Leadership Role)
description:
Operations & Account Manager (U.S. Security – 24/7 Leadership Role)

Remote (Philippines) | Full-Time | 9:00 AM–5:00 PM PST + On-Call



We operate a 24/7 U.S.-based security services company managing 50+ field employees. We are hiring a leader, not an assistant.



You will own scheduling, coverage control, client communication, and operational stability. If coverage breaks, you fix it. If a client escalates, you take control. If a guard becomes unstable, you address it.



This role requires real operations leadership.



Core Responsibilities

• Manage daily scheduling for 50+ U.S. field employees

• Prevent missed shifts and coverage gaps

• Handle call-offs, replacements, OT control, and shift adjustments

• Enforce SLA response times

• Communicate professionally with U.S. clients

• Maintain strict CRM documentation in GoHighLevel

• Coordinate with dispatch, HR, and finance

• Track attendance, performance issues, and guard stability



Required Experience (Strict)

• 3+ years in operations, dispatch, logistics, or 24/7 service environments

• Experience managing scheduling for 30+ field employees

• Experience handling call-offs and urgent coverage issues

• Experience using GoHighLevel (required)

• Experience with CRM/ticketing systems

• Basic HR experience (attendance, discipline, performance issues)

• Strong English communication (written + verbal)

• Comfortable making decisions without supervision



If you have not managed scheduling at scale, do not apply.



Schedule

• 9:00 AM–5:00 PM PST

• Must be available for urgent operational matters after hours



Compensation

• $6–$10 USD/hour

• Performance-based raises

• Growth path into Senior Operations Lead



Application Requirements (Mandatory)

Submit ALL of the following:

 1. Resume (PDF)

 2. 2-minute video explaining your experience managing 30+ field staff

 3. 60-second voice recording confirming PST + on-call availability

 4. List of systems you’ve used (must include GoHighLevel)



Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.



We are hiring ownership, not task followers.

title: Long-Term Wedding Photo Editor (Lightroom + Photoshop) – Detail-Oriented & Deadline Driven
description:
My name is Kayla and I am a Wedding & Portrait Photographer looking for a reliable freelance photo editor to help bring my images to life with careful attention to style, detail, and consistency for a part of this year, next year and years to come ideally!



I currently have at least 4 weddings to edit between March and April, plus 20 weddings booked for this year from May - November with sessions scattered throughout the year. This is the work I have guaranteed right now, but as I book more sessions and weddings, they will be added onto a task board right away so that you can see well in advance what I'll need help with and when it would be due, which will give you plenty of time to plan your life and other editing jobs accordingly around that.



As a heads up, I use an Ai editing tool to help me with the base edit so that the editing process is as efficient as possible. This means you would receive a Lightroom catalog with the images partially or mostly edited, but I still need help getting them fully completed through cropping, straightening, brush work, spot removal / eliminating distractions exposure + temperature correction, etc. and ensuring the images match my signature style.



Since the Ai editing tool will be taking care of the base edit, this means that it will take you less time per image to finish the edit to the standard I'm looking for since there will already be a base edit applied. For this reason, I'm looking for someone who can fine tune these images for $0.12 CAD per image. There will also be Photoshop retouching needed on a case by case basis, which includes advanced object removal and head swaps (only on selected images) and comes at an additional pay at $0.12 CAD per image.



Here is what I need help with:



-Fine tuning/editing about
+ photos per wedding in Lightroom using a preset I work with

-Fine tuning/editing about 15-50+photos per session Lightroom using a preset I work with

-Using brush tool, graduated filters, cropping, straightening, and making sure the Al tool got the correct exposure and colour temperature (you will be trained on how I edit my photos)

- Object removal and head swaps using Photoshop on a case by case basis 



What I am NOT looking for:



*If you are disorganized or have difficulty with deadlines and structure, please do not apply. 

*If you can't take honest feedback well and can learn quickly from the feedback, please do not apply.

* If you have an unreliable internet connection, please do not apply.



What I'm looking for:

* Seeking a long-term, part-time seasonal role, with primary work between May - November. 

*Dedicated, Loyal, On-Time, Organized, Hits Deadlines, Detail Oriented, Creative, Quick Learner, strong in English

*Strong attention to detail and the ability to follow creative direction.

*Experienced in Adobe Lightroom and Photoshop.

*Someone who takes responsibility for the work they do and doesn't make excuses 

*Someone who prides themselves on being detail-oriented and creating consistent high quality results

*Someone who is EXCITED to edit wedding and couples photos full of emotion and beauty 

*Ideally someone who could support me with having a 5-7 day turnaround time for weddings and a 2-3 business day turnaround time for sessions.



If this sounds like you and you'd love to connect more about this opportunity, reply to this job post with the following: your WhatsApp number, your
, let me know if you have Photoshop / Lightroom, let me know if you have a strong internet connection, why you love editing photos for other photographers, if $0.12 CAD per image works for you, examples of edited work you enjoyed editing, and an inspirational quote that makes you happy,



As a heads up, I will only be responding to applicants that I will select for the interview process, so if you don't hear back fro
 by March 3rd, I've d
 to go in a different direction.



- Kayla

title: Digital Operations & Executive Virtual Assistant
description:
We are looking for a reliable and tech-savvy Digital Operations & Executive Virtual Assistant to help organize, set up, and manage digital systems for an online education and coaching business.



This role is ideal for a generalist VA who enjoys building systems, organizing content, and supporting day-to-day operations. You will help turn existing content and ideas into structured online programs, courses, and smooth client experiences.



This is a remote, Philippine daytime with overlap with U.S. business hours



Job duties and responsibilities:

 

     1. Website & Platform Support

            - Assist with basic website setup and page updates

            - Build and update landing pages using GoHighLevel (or similar tools)

            - Ensure pages are organized, clean, and functional



     2. Course & Content Management

            - Upload and organize course content (documents, videos, resources)

            - Set up online programs, classes, and memberships

            - Manage student access before, during, and after programs



     3. Scheduling & Client Coordination

            - Set up and manage booking links for calls, classes, and workshops

            - Send confirmations, reminders, and follow-ups

            - Coordinate Zoom links and session details



      4. CRM &
 Automation

            - Manage contacts inside the CRM

            - Set up basic
 automations (welcome
s, reminders, onboarding
s)

            - Apply tags, segments, and simple workflows



      5. Social Media & Online Support

            - Assist with organizing and scheduling content

            - Repurpose existing content for online use

            - Maintain consistency across platforms (no heavy content creation required)



       6. General Admin & Executive Support

            - Turn raw notes, documents, and ideas into finished digital assets

            - Keep files and systems organized

            - Support ongoing tasks as the business grows



Qualifications

       - Experience with GoHighLevel (GHL) is a strong plus

       - Familiar with CRM systems,
 automations, and scheduling tools

       - Experience with online course platforms is an advantage

       - Organized, proactive, and comfortable learning new tools



If you believe you're a strong fit for this position, please respond with the following:



     1. A link to your resume in PDF format.

title: Structural Engineer (Virtual Assistant) – Modular & Steel Construction
description:
Structural Engineer (Virtual Assistant) – Modular & Steel Construction



Full-Time | Remote | Australian Company



BB Building Services & Rapid Modular Homes are growing, and we’re looking for a highly capable Structural Engineer (Remote / VA) to join our team long-term.



We design and build modular homes, sheds, and steel structures across regional NSW, Australia. We are building repeatable systems — not one-off guesswork — and we need an engineer who can design properly, think critically, and work closely with our estimator and draftsman.



This is a serious role with long-term opportunity.



???? Your Role



You will:



Design structural steel systems for modular buildings



Perform structural calculations (wind, loads, lifting, transport etc.)



Prepare full calculation reports



Review and improve shop drawings



Design footings and slab systems



Work closely with our draftsman and estimator



Prepare complete engineering packages ready for Australian certification review



Help us refine and standardise our modular system



You will not be certifying projects (Australian engineers will do final sign-off), but your work must be accurate and certifiable.



???? Required Experience



You must have:



5+ years structural engineering experience



Strong steel design experience



Experience with portal frames / light gauge steel



Experience designing for wind loads



Experience preparing structural calculation reports



Proficiency in ETABS, STAAD, SAP2000, Tekla, or similar



Strong English communication skills



Bonus points if you have:



Modular / prefabricated construction experience



Experience working with Australian or international codes



Experience designing transportable structures



???????? Knowledge of Australian Standards (Preferred)



Experience or willingness to work within:



AS 4100 – Steel Structures



AS/NZS 1170 – Structural Design Actions



AS 3600 – Concrete Structures



NCC (National Construction Code)



We will guide you, but you must be technically capable.

title: Cloud Security Technical Lead (Microsoft 365 Focus)
description:
Location: Remote (Philippines)

Company: Australia-based Managed IT & Security Provider



About Us



We’re an Australia-based IT Managed Services & Security provider that has been helping businesses for 8+ years with Managed IT, Microsoft 365 Security, and Essential 8 compliance. We’re now on a mission to scale rapidly and are looking for a Senior PH Technical Lead who can own delivery discipline, enforce SOPs, and mentor the team while keeping clients secure.



The Role



This isn’t just another engineering job. You will be the backbone of our offshore team, ensuring tickets are triaged, SLA discipline is followed, and our security-first approach (M365 + Essential 8) is consistently applied.



Key Responsibilities



- Triage & Ticket Discipline : Own daily triage rotation, enforce SOPs, ensure zero tickets are left untriaged at EOD.

- QA & Standards : Review ticket quality, escalate misses, and enforce client comms standards.

- M365 Security Leadership :  Drive improvements in Secure Score, Conditional Access, Intune, and Essential 8 L1 compliance.

- Mentorship : Guide and upskill junior PH engineers, enforce accountability.

- Client Impact : Collaborate with AU engineers to ensure top clients have strong security + reduced ticket backlog.



Requirements

3+ years MSP experience (non-negotiable). You must be comfortable with SLA-driven environments and ticketing systems (Halo, ConnectWise, Autotask, etc.).

Strong hands-on skills in:

Microsoft 365 Admin, Security & Compliance, Intune, Conditional Access

Essential 8 or similar cyber frameworks

Experience leading small teams or mentoring juniors.

Excellent written English for ticket notes + client comms.

Proactive mindset — you don’t wait, you enforce.



Why Join Us?



Career Pathway: Step into a Service Delivery Lead (PH) role as we grow.

Stable Company: 8+ years serving Australian businesses, strong client base.

Growth Mission: Be part of scaling rapidly — your impact will be visible.

Culture: We run on SOPs, discipline, and a no-blame mindset. If you want to grow, this is the place.



Compensation



Competitive salary PHP 70,000–120,000/month (depending on experience).

Performance bonuses for SLA discipline + client satisfaction.



How to Apply



Send your resume + 1-paragraph note on: “How I have enforced SLA discipline or QA in a past MSP role.”

title: AI-Native Generalist
description:
The Role

I am looking for a high-speed, AI-native developer who specializes in "rapid execution." I don’t need someone to spend months on a single project; I need a technical partner who can take a random idea and turn it into a working reality in 48 to 72 hours.



You aren’t just a coder - you are an expert at leveraging the world’s best AI models to bypass traditional development timelines. If you can’t build it from scratch, you know exactly how to prompt an AI to help you build it, fix it, and ship it.



What You’ll Be Doing

I’m going to throw a constant stream of "sprint tasks" at you. You’ll be the person who makes things happen across a wide variety of platforms.



Projects include:



Web Ops: Building quick sites with functional backends.



Automations: Setting up content creation workflows, n8n/Make sequences, or custom scripts.



Bot Builds: Deploying 
/Telegram bots and integrating Claude or GPT-4o into custom tools.



General Tech Setup: Handling "anti-tasks"—the random technical hurdles that pop up and need to be solved now.



Who You Are

Highly Adaptable: You don’t have "one stack." You use whatever tool gets the job done fastest.



AI-Fluent: You use AI to 10x your output. If you aren't using the latest models to work faster, this isn't for you.



Speed-Obsessed: You thrive on variety and move fast. You prefer finishing three small projects a week over one big project a month.



Reliable: When I ask for a change or a new tool, you iterate quickly and keep the 
ntum going.



The Perks

Consistent Work: This is a long-term, ongoing role. As long as you deliver, I have projects for you.



Insider Access: You’ll get full access to the software I sell and the internal tools we use.



Future Growth: Perform well here, and you’ll be the first person I go to for the bigger opportunities and ventures coming down the line.

title: AI Artist / Graphic Designer
description:
ABOUT US



Earth Moon Magick is a spiritual indie brand house creating oracle and tarot decks, journals, and divination tools. Our products are designed to help people reconnect with themselves through symbolism, beauty, and emotional resonance. We’re a remote team and we collaborate with artists worldwide.



We’re currently looking for a high quality AI Illustrator to help us create full decks with consistent, soulful, dreamy visuals — and to grow with us long-term.



RESPONSIBILITIES



- Create full oracle/tarot decks (44–88 final images per deck), using a mix between AI and photoshop, etc.

- Adapt prompts + style based on our art direction, theme, and moodboard (and contribute ideas!!)

- Maintain stylistic consistency across a full deck (characters, lighting, palette, composition, symbols)

- Refine outputs using a combination of tools when needed (Midjourney + ChatGPT / “Nano Banana” / other workflows)

- Create mockups / 3D-like visuals for marketing, previews, and presentations (any method/tools you prefer)

- Collaborate with our creative team and accept feedback with professionalism + ease

- Support multiple deck projects per year (goal: **4+ projects/year**) once the collaboration is flowing



QUALIFICATIONS



Mandatory:

- Advanced Midjourney skills (prompting, style consistency, iteration, upscaling, variation control, etc.)

- Strong eye for art direction, composition, and storytelling

- Extremely creative and enthusiastic about this work

- Ability to consistently create images that feel mystical, feminine, dreamy, symbolic, and mature

- Ability to connect with a spiritually mature audience that appreciates soulful artistic storytelling.

- Excellent communication + reliability (meeting deadlines, updating progress, responding clearly)

- Comfortable showing your “behind the scenes” process (prompt evolution + iteration choices)



Preferred (nice to have):

- Experience creating cohesive series (decks, collections, character sets, story worlds)

- Familiarity with tarot/oracle symbolism and archetypes

- Mockup / graphic design experience (Photoshop, Canva, Figma, mockup tools, etc.)

- Ability to edit or enhance details post-generation (where needed)



EXPECTATIONS

(how good you need to be)



- You can hold one consistent visual universe across 50–80 images

- You understand that oracle/tarot art must carry emotion + meaning, not just look pretty

- You include the phrase “SILVER DOLPHIN” in the subject + top of your reply so we know you read the full description

- You can follow direction and problem-solve when something isn’t working

- You have the humility to ask questions when you don't know something

- You can iterate quickly while maintaining quality

- You communicate progress clearly (and collaborate along the way)



SALARY & HOURS



Starting at ~$600* USD/month (part-time, ongoing support + collaboration) (*salary can be adjusted, dependent on skill level). Opportunity for bonuses and pay advances depending on performance and growth within the company.



HOW TO APPLY



Please reply with:



1. Your Midjourney profile (or showcase link)

2. Your portfolio (ArtStation or external) featuring AI work

3. 2–5 examples of prompts you wrote (and what you were trying to achieve)

4. A short answer: What do you think makes AI art feel soulful instead of generic?

5. "SILVER DOLPHIN" in the subject line of your reply to us.

title: Video Editor for Spiritual Brand
description:
About Us



Earth Moon Magick is an independent publishing house devoted to creating oracle and tarot decks; and some other sacred tools that inspire self-discovery, creativity, and spiritual connection. We’re a small team of four. We are heart-centred and deeply value authenticity, integrity, and connection... and we’re expanding our team to help expand our impact!



Even though this is a part-time role, if it's a solid fit, it can quickly shift into a higher pay and full-time.



Role Overview: We’re looking for a video editor (ideally attuned to spirituality, intuition, and feminine storytelling) to create 5–10 short videos per week (15–30 sec each) for Meta ads and social platforms.



You’ll work closely with our creative director to turn raw footage, UGC, and product clips into emotionally charged, high-converting videos.



Your Mission: Transform simple visuals into magnetic, cinematic ads that make people feel the energy before they buy.



Your edits should embody:

~ Soft, sacred pacing: slow transitions, breath 
nts, light flares.

~ Luxury feel: macro details, shimmering foil, warm golden tones.

~ Emotional depth: storytelling that evokes remembrance, connection, beauty.



Responsibilities

~ Edit 3–10 short-form videos per week.

~ Adapt footage into multiple aspect ratios (1:1, 9:16, 16:9).

~ Add captions, music, and subtle sound design aligned with brand tone.

~ Follow brand video angles and guidelines.

~ Collaborate with creative team for new ad variations and A/B tests.



Potential Responsibilities  (a big plus if you have experience with these!)

~ Content Creation

~ Photography



Requirements

~ Strong experience with Meta or TikTok-style ad editing.

~ Portfolio showing emotionally driven storytelling (spiritual, luxury, or lifestyle brands preferred).

~ Fluent in English.

~ Organized, creative, and passionate about spirituality or conscious living.

~ Available for consistent weekly delivery and responsive communication.



Expectations:

- You communicate clearly and promptly with the internal team.

- You’re proactive—spotting potential issues before they escalate.

- You’re reliable, consistent, and eager to learn new systems and processes.

- You care about the energy you bring to the role and want to grow within a purpose-driven and professionally-driven company.

- To show that you’ve read this entire post, please include the word BACKPACK in your message subject line when you apply.



Nice-to-Haves

~ Interest in tarot, oracle, feminine embodiment, and visual storytelling.

~ Experience with After Effects, CapCut Pro, or Premiere Pro.

~ Eye for music selection and pacing.



Type: Part-Time (20 videos/month minimum, potential for full-time)

Pay Range: USD 400–700/month, depending on experience and speed
